file.name: file-to-string-transformer
file.description: Creates a 'org.springframework.integration.file.transformer.FileToStringTransformer' that converts a File payload to a String.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (EventDrivenConsumer)

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Set the charset name to use when converting a File payload to a String, e.g. charset="UTF-8". If not set, the default charset of this Java virtual machine is used.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The input channel of the transformer.

attributes.name: delete-files
attributes.description: The delete-files option signals to the transformer that it should delete the inbound File after the transformation is complete.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: The channel to which the transformer will send the transformed message. Optional, because incoming messages can specify a reply channel using the 'replyChannel' message header value themselves.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

file.name: outbound-channel-adapter
file.description: Configures a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.file.FileWritingMessageHandler' with 'expectReply = false' that writes Message payloads to a File.

attributes.name: auto-create-directory
attributes.description: Specify whether to automatically create the destination directory if it does not yet exist when this adapter is being initialized. The default value is 'true'. If set to 'false' and the directory does not exist upon initialization, an Exception will be thrown.

attributes.name: preserve-timestamp
attributes.description: Specify whether to preserve the modified timestamp from the source file on the destination file after copying. Applies to 'java.io.File' payloads. For other payload types, the optional 'file_setModified' header will be used, if present (and a 'Number'), to set the lastModified time. By default, the timestamp will NOT be preserved.

attributes.name: filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a SpEL expression which will compute the file name of the target file (e.g., assuming payload is java.io.File "payload.name + '.transferred'");

attributes.name: append-new-line
attributes.description: Set to 'true' to append a new-line after each write. It is 'false' by default.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (EventDrivenConsumer)

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: This attribute defaults to 'REPLACE' if not set explicitly. The following options are available: APPEND: If append is specified, the data will be appended to the existing file if such file exists, otherwise the new file will be created as usual but, once created, the subsequent data will be appended to it. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the use of a temporary file, since append is done to the actual file and not its temporary counterpart. The file is closed after each write. If set to APPEND, the component will also use instance of the LockRegistry to ensure that there are no collisions when multiple threads are writing to the same file. APPEND_NO_FLUSH: Same as 'APPEND' but the data is not flushed or the file closed. This can significantly improve performance at the risk of lost data in the event of a failure. Various strategies are available for flushing the data and closing the file. Refer to the reference documentation for more information. FAIL: If the target file exists, a MessageHandlingException is thrown. IGNORE: If the target file exists, the message payload is silently ignored. REPLACE: This is the default behavior when writing files. If the target file already exists, it will be overwritten. REPLACE_IF_MODIFIED: If the local file already exists, it will be overwritten only if the last modified timestamp does not match the source timestamp. Only applies to local files.

attributes.name: flush-interval
attributes.description: When using 'mode=APPEND_NO_FLUSH', if this time (ms) elapses without any new writes, the data is flushed and the file closed. Default 30000.

attributes.name: flush-when-idle
attributes.description: When using 'mode=APPEND_NO_FLUSH', set to false to indicate the 'flush-interval' starts from the first new write to a previously flushed (or new) file. When true, the interval starts from the last write (the file is flushed if it has no writes during the interval). Default true.

attributes.name: directory
attributes.description: Specifies the output directory, e.g.: directory="file:/absolute/output" or directory="file:relative/output" Either this attribute or 'directory-expression' must be provided.

attributes.name: filename-generator
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a reference to the FileNameGenerator strategy to use when generating the destination file's name. If not specified the DefaultFileNameGenerator is used.

attributes.name: delete-source-files
attributes.description: Specify whether to delete source files after writing to the destination directory. This will take effect if the Message payload is the actual source File instance or if the original File instance (or its path) is available in the header value associated with the FileHeaders.ORIGINAL_FILE constant. The default value is false.

attributes.name: directory-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the output directory using a SpEL expression. This allows you to dynamically specify the output directory on a per message basis. For example a message header or payload property can be used for specifying the destination directory at runtime.

attributes.name: temporary-file-suffix
attributes.description: Extension used when uploading files. We change it after we know it's uploaded. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'append' since the append is done to the actual file and not its temporary counterpart. The default value of this attribute (i.e., .writing) is ignored when 'append' is set to true.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a SubscribableChannel.

attributes.name: chmod
attributes.description: Change the mode of the file (or remote file) after writing. Integer value expressed in Octal, e.g. '644'.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: The channel through which outgoing messages will arrive.

attributes.name: buffer-size
attributes.description: The buffer size to use when writing to files. Default 8192 bytes.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: flush-predicate
attributes.description: When using 'mode=APPEND_NO_FLUSH', a reference to a 'FlushPredicate' implementation used when a message is sent to the message handler's 'MessageTriggerAction.trigger()' method. By default, the payload of such a message must be a Regex used to match the file absolute path.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Set the charset name to use when writing a File from a String-based Message payload, e.g. charset="UTF-8". If not set, the default charset of this Java virtual machine is used.

file.name: splitter
file.description: Creates a 'org.springframework.integration.file.splitter.FileSplitter' that splits text-based files into lines.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (EventDrivenConsumer)

attributes.name: markers
attributes.description: Set to 'true' to emit start/end of file marker messages before and after the file data. Markers are messages with 'FileSplitter.FileMarker' payloads (with 'START' and 'END' values in the 'mark' property). Markers might be used when sequentially processing files in a downstream flow where some lines are filtered. The 'END' marker includes a line count. They enable the downstream processing to know when a file has been completely processed. A header 'file_marker' is also added, containing START/END appropriately. Default: 'false'. When 'true', 'apply-sequence' is 'false' by default. Also see 'markers-json'.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.name: discard-channel
attributes.description: The channel where the splitter will send the messages that return an empty container from split function.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: first-line-as-header
attributes.description: The header name for the first line to be carried as a header in the messages emitted for the remaining lines.

attributes.name: apply-sequence
attributes.description: Set this flag to determine whether sequence related headers are added to messages from this splitter. When true, existing correlation and sequence related headers are pushed onto a stack; downstream components, such as aggregators may pop the stack to revert the existing headers after aggregation. Default is 'true' unless 'markers' is 'true'. Also see 'iterator'.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Set the charset name to use when reading bytes from the text-based file into String payloads, e.g. charset="UTF-8". If not set, the default charset of this Java virtual machine is used.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: markers-json
attributes.description: When 'markers' is true, if this is 'true', the message payload of the marker is a JSON String representation of the marker object. Requires a supported JSON processor library on the classpath (Jackson, Boon).

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: Specify whether the splitter must return at least one message. This value will be 'false' by default, but if set to 'true', a ReplyRequiredException will be thrown when the file has no data.

attributes.name: iterator
attributes.description: Set this flag to determine whether the lines are emitted via an iterator (line at a time) or the whole file is read into memory and then the lines emitted. When this is 'true', if 'apply-sequence' is also 'true', the 'sequenceSize' header is set to '0'. Default: 'true'.

file.name: tail-inbound-channel-adapter
file.description: Configures a Message Producing Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.file.tail.FileTailingMessageProducerSupport that 'tails' a file on the filesystem.

attributes.name: reopen
attributes.description: Does not apply to the native adapter. If 'true', close and reopen the file between reading chunks. Default 'false'. Note: Setting this option forces the use of the Apache Tailer implementation instead of the native 'tail' command.

attributes.name: task-scheduler
attributes.description: A reference to a TaskScheduler; the default is the 'taskScheduler' bean which is automatically configured for all Spring Integration applications. The scheduler is used by the native adapter to reschedule the 'tail' process after a failure according to the 'file-delay', and also it is used to emit idle event.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. Depending on the type of the adapter this channel could be the receiving channel (e.g., outbound-channel-adapter) or channel where messages will be sent to by this adapter (e.g., inbound-channel-adapter).

attributes.name: end
attributes.description: Does not apply to the native adapter. Set to 'true' to tail from the end of the file, 'false' to tail from the beginning of the file. Default 'true'. Note: Setting this option forces the use of the Apache Tailer implementation instead of the native 'tail' command.

attributes.name: native-options
attributes.description: Configures the adapter to exec 'tail' with these options (appended by the file name). Default: "-F -n 0" (follow the filename and emit no existing lines). This attribute is not allowed if 'delay' 'end' or 'reopen' is specified, which cause the Apache commons-io 'Tailer' class to be used instead of using a native 'tail' command.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: file-delay
attributes.description: The delay in milliseconds between attempts to open the file when no file was found (Apache adapter). For the native adapter, this is used as a delay before starting a new process after process failures. On some platforms, when the file doesn't exist, the 'tail' process is suspended until the file appears; on other platforms, the 'tail' process exits immediately if the file doesn't exist. Default 5000.

attributes.name: idle-event-interval
attributes.description: The delay in milliseconds between idle events when no new lines are being tailed.

attributes.name: task-executor
attributes.description: A reference to a TaskExecutor; the default is a SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor; the native adapter uses three threads - one for reading stdout, one for reading stderr and one for monitoring the process.

attributes.name: file
attributes.description: The fully qualified name of the file to be tailed.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Message Channel to which error Messages should be sent.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: Does not apply to the native adapter - the delay in milliseconds between polls when no new data was detected in the file. Default 1000. Note: Setting this option forces the use of the Apache Tailer implementation instead of the native 'tail' command.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: enable-status-reader
attributes.description: Configure the adapter to either start a thread for capturing stderr or not. Default: True

file.name: inbound-channel-adapter
file.description: Configures a 'SourcePollingChannelAdapter' Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.file.FileReadingMessageSource' that polls a directory and sends Messages whose payloads are instances of java.io.File.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. Depending on the type of the adapter this channel could be the receiving channel (e.g., outbound-channel-adapter) or channel where messages will be sent to by this adapter (e.g., inbound-channel-adapter).

attributes.name: scan-each-poll
attributes.description: Set this flag if you want to make sure the internal queue is refreshed with the latest content of the input directory on each poll.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: filename-pattern
attributes.description: Only files matching this ant style path will be picked up by this adapter. Note that in Spring Integration 1.0 this attribute accepted a regular expression, but from 2.0 filename-regex should be used for that purpose instead.

attributes.name: comparator
attributes.description: Specify a Comparator to be used when ordering Files. If none is provided, the order will be determined by the java.io.File implementation of Comparable. MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE with queue-size.

attributes.name: prevent-duplicates
attributes.description: A boolean flag indicating whether duplicates should be prevented. If a 'filter' reference is provided, duplicate prevention will not be enabled by default (the assumption is that the provided filter is sufficient), but setting this to true will enable it. If a 'filename-pattern' is provided, duplicate prevention will be enabled by default (preceding the pattern matching), but setting this to false will disable it. If neither 'filter' or 'filename-pattern' is provided, duplicate prevention is enabled by default, but setting this to false will disable it. For more detail on the actual duplicate prevention, see the javadoc for AcceptOnceFileListFilter.

attributes.name: use-watch-service
attributes.description: Indicates if the 'FileReadingMessageSource' should use an internal 'DirectoryScanner' for the Java 7 'WatchService'. Mutually exclusive with 'scanner' attribute.

attributes.name: ignore-hidden
attributes.description: A boolean flag indicating whether hidden files shall be ignored. If set to 'false', hidden files will be processed. If not specified, this value will default to 'true' and an 'IgnoreHiddenFileListFilter' will be added.

attributes.name: auto-create-directory
attributes.description: Specify whether to automatically create the source directory if it does not yet exist when this adapter is being initialized. The default value is 'true'. If set to 'false' and the directory does not exist upon initialization, an Exception will be thrown.

attributes.name: filename-regex
attributes.description: Only files matching this regular expression will be picked up by this adapter.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: filter-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate against file to accept it for processing or not. Mutually exclusive with 'filter' attribute.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Specify a FileListFilter to be used. By default, an AcceptOnceFileListFilter is used, which ensures files are picked up only once from the directory. You can also apply multiple filters by referencing a CompositeFileListFilter.

attributes.name: watch-events
attributes.description: Comma-separated value for the 'FileReadingMessageSource.WatchEventType's to specify which kinds of files system events the 'WatchService' will listen to. Used only if 'use-watch-service == true'.

attributes.name: scanner
attributes.description: Reference to a custom DirectoryScanner implementation. Mutually exclusive with 'use-watch-service' attribute.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: directory
attributes.description: Specifies the input directory (The directory to poll from) e.g.: directory="file:/absolute/input" or directory="file:relative/input"

attributes.name: queue-size
attributes.description: Specify the maximum number of files stored in memory by the underlying FileReadingMessageSource. This is useful to limit the memory footprint of this endpoint. Using a stateful filter would counter this benefit, so AcceptOnceFileListFilter is not used when this attribute is specified. MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE with comparator, if comparator is set this attribute will be ignored. MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE with stateful filtering.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: locker
children.description: When multiple processes are reading from the same directory it can be desirable to lock files to prevent them from being picked up concurrently. To do this you can specify a reference to a FileLocker.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: The reference to the FileLocker.

children.name: nio-locker
children.description: When multiple processes are reading from the same directory it can be desirable to lock files to prevent them from being picked up concurrently. This is a java.nio based implementation available out of the box.

file.name: outbound-gateway
file.description: Configures a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.file.FileWritingMessageHandler' that writes request Message payloads to a File and then generates a reply Message containing the newly written File as its payload.

attributes.name: filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a SpEL expression which will compute the file name of the target file (e.g., assuming payload is java.io.File "payload.name + '.transferred'");

attributes.name: append-new-line
attributes.description: Set to 'true' to append a new-line after each write. It is 'false' by default.

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: Specify whether this outbound gateway must return a non-null value. This value is 'true' by default, and a ReplyRequiredException will be thrown when the underlying service returns a null value.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (EventDrivenConsumer)

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: flush-when-idle
attributes.description: When using 'mode=APPEND_NO_FLUSH', set to false to indicate the 'flush-interval' starts from the first new write to a previously flushed (or new) file. When true, the interval starts from the last write (the file is flushed if it has no writes during the interval). Default true.

attributes.name: directory
attributes.description: Specifies the output directory, e.g.: directory="file:/absolute/output" or directory="file:relative/output" Either this attribute or 'directory-expression' must be provided.

attributes.name: filename-generator
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a reference to the FileNameGenerator strategy to use when generating the destination file's name. If not specified the DefaultFileNameGenerator is used.

attributes.name: delete-source-files
attributes.description: Specify whether to delete source files after writing to the destination directory. This will take effect if the Message payload is the actual source File instance or if the original File instance (or its path) is available in the header value associated with the FileHeaders.ORIGINAL_FILE constant. The default value is false.

attributes.name: reply-channel
attributes.description: After writing the File, it will be sent to the specified reply channel as the payload of a Message. Another way of providing the 'reply-channel' is by setting the MessageHeaders.REPLY_CHANNEL Message Header

attributes.name: request-channel
attributes.description: The channel through which outgoing messages will arrive.

attributes.name: buffer-size
attributes.description: The buffer size to use when writing to files. Default 8192 bytes.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: flush-predicate
attributes.description: When using 'mode=APPEND_NO_FLUSH', a reference to a 'FlushPredicate' implementation used when a message is sent to the message handler's 'MessageTriggerAction.trigger()' method. By default, the payload of such a message must be a Regex used to match the file absolute path.

attributes.name: auto-create-directory
attributes.description: Specify whether to automatically create the destination directory if it does not yet exist when this adapter is being initialized. The default value is 'true'. If set to 'false' and the directory does not exist upon initialization, an Exception will be thrown.

attributes.name: preserve-timestamp
attributes.description: Specify whether to preserve the modified timestamp from the source file on the destination file after copying. Applies to 'java.io.File' payloads. For other payload types, the optional 'file_setModified' header will be used, if present (and a 'Number'), to set the lastModified time. By default, the timestamp will NOT be preserved.

attributes.name: reply-timeout
attributes.description: Allows you to specify how long this gateway will wait for the reply message to be sent successfully to the reply channel before throwing an exception. This attribute only applies when the channel might block, for example when using a bounded queue channel that is currently full. Also, keep in mind that when sending to a DirectChannel, the invocation will occur in the sender's thread. Therefore, the failing of the send operation may be caused by other components further downstream. The "reply-timeout" attribute maps to the "sendTimeout" property of the underlying 'MessagingTemplate' instance (org.springframework.integration.core.MessagingTemplate). The attribute will default, if not specified, to '-1', meaning that by default, the Gateway will wait indefinitely. The value is specified in milliseconds.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: This attribute defaults to 'REPLACE' if not set explicitly. The following options are available: APPEND: If append is specified, the data will be appended to the existing file if such file exists, otherwise the new file will be created as usual but, once created, the subsequent data will be appended to it. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the use of a temporary file, since append is done to the actual file and not its temporary counterpart. The file is closed after each write. If set to APPEND, the component will also use instance of the LockRegistry to ensure that there are no collisions when multiple threads are writing to the same file. APPEND_NO_FLUSH: Same as 'APPEND' but the data is not flushed or the file closed. This can significantly improve performance at the risk of lost data in the event of a failure. Various strategies are available for flushing the data and closing the file. Refer to the reference documentation for more information. FAIL: If the target file exists, a MessageHandlingException is thrown. IGNORE: If the target file exists, the message payload is silently ignored. REPLACE: This is the default behavior when writing files. If the target file already exists, it will be overwritten. REPLACE_IF_MODIFIED: If the local file already exists, it will be overwritten only if the last modified timestamp does not match the source timestamp. Only applies to local files.

attributes.name: flush-interval
attributes.description: When using 'mode=APPEND_NO_FLUSH', if this time (ms) elapses without any new writes, the data is flushed and the file closed. Default 30000.

attributes.name: directory-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the output directory using a SpEL expression. This allows you to dynamically specify the output directory on a per message basis. For example a message header or payload property can be used for specifying the destination directory at runtime.

attributes.name: temporary-file-suffix
attributes.description: Extension used when uploading files. We change it after we know it's uploaded. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'append' since the append is done to the actual file and not its temporary counterpart. The default value of this attribute (i.e., .writing) is ignored when 'append' is set to true.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a SubscribableChannel.

attributes.name: chmod
attributes.description: Change the mode of the file (or remote file) after writing. Integer value expressed in Octal, e.g. '644'.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Set the charset name to use when writing a File from a String-based Message payload, e.g. charset="UTF-8". If not set, the default charset of this Java virtual machine is used.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

ftp.name: inbound-channel-adapter
ftp.description: Configures a 'SourcePollingChannelAdapter' Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.ftp.inbound.FtpInboundFileSynchronizingMessageSource' that synchronizes a local directory with the contents of a remote FTP endpoint.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: preserve-timestamp
attributes.description: Specify whether to preserve the modified timestamp from the remote source file on the local file after copying. By default, the remote timestamp will NOT be preserved.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. The channel to which messages will be sent by this adapter.

attributes.name: remote-file-separator
attributes.description: Allows you to provide remote file/directory separator character. DEFAULT: '/'

attributes.name: temporary-file-suffix
attributes.description: Extension used when downloading files. We change it right after we know it's downloaded.

attributes.name: local-filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to a [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter is applied to files after they have been retrieved. The default is an AcceptOnceFileListFilter which means that, even if a new instance of a file is retrieved from the remote server, a message won't be generated. The filter provided here is combined with a filter that prevents the message source from processing files that are currently being downloaded.

attributes.name: metadata-store-prefix
attributes.description: Specify a prefix for metadata store to distinguish keys from another places where the same shared store is used. By default, the remote a component name is used.

attributes.name: max-fetch-size
attributes.description: When fetching objects from some external resource, limit the number of such objects that will be retrieved on each fetch. A negative value (default) indicates no limit; a value of zero effectively disables fetching remote objects.

attributes.name: local-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the directory path (e.g., "/local/mytransfers") where files will be transferred TO.

attributes.name: comparator
attributes.description: Specify a Comparator to be used when ordering Files. If none is provided, the order will be determined by the java.io.File implementation of Comparable.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: scanner
attributes.description: Reference to a custom DirectoryScanner implementation.

attributes.name: remote-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specify a SpEL expression which will be used to evaluate the directory path to where the files will be transferred (e.g., "headers.['remote_dir'] + '/myTransfers'" for outbound endpoints) There is no root object (message) for inbound endpoints (e.g., "@someBean.fetchDirectory");

attributes.name: local-filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a SpEL expression to generate the file name of the local (transferred) file. The root object of the SpEL evaluation is the name of the original file. For example, a valid expression would be "#this.toUpperCase() + '.a'" where #this represents the original name of the remote file.

attributes.name: auto-create-local-directory
attributes.description: Tells this adapter if the local directory must be auto-created if it doesn't exist. Default is TRUE.

attributes.name: delete-remote-files
attributes.description: Specify whether to delete the remote source file after copying. By default, the remote files will NOT be deleted.

attributes.name: filename-pattern
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a file name pattern to determine the file names that need to be scanned. This is based on simple pattern matching (e.g., "*.txt, fo*.txt" etc.)

attributes.name: remote-file-metadata-store
attributes.description: Reference to a MetadataStore for saving remote files information between synchronization and polling.

attributes.name: session-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an [org.springframework.integration.file.remote.session.SessionFactory] bean with an [org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPFile] generic type parameter.

attributes.name: filter-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate against file to accept it for processing or not. Mutually exclusive with 'filter' attribute.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to a [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter is applied to files on the remote server and only files that pass the filter are retrieved.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: remote-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the remote directory path (e.g., "/remote/mytransfers") Mutually exclusive with 'remote-directory-expression'.

attributes.name: filename-regex
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a Regular Expression to determine the file names that need to be scanned. (e.g., "f[o]+\.txt" etc.)

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

ftp.name: outbound-gateway
ftp.description: Configures a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.ftp.gateway.FtpOutboundGateway' used to issue FTP commands.

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: Specify whether this outbound gateway must return a non-null value. This value is 'true' by default, and a ReplyRequiredException will be thrown when the underlying service returns a null value.

attributes.name: mput-regex
attributes.description: Allows you to provide Regular Expression to determine the file names sent by the 'mput' command (e.g., "f[o]+\.txt" etc.) Only one of 'mput-filter', 'mput-pattern', or 'mput-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: auto-create-directory
attributes.description: Specify whether to automatically create the remote target directory if it doesn't exist.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: mput-filter-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate against file to accept it for processing or not. Mutually exclusive with 'mput-filter' attribute.

attributes.name: mput-filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter acts on the local file system when using the 'mput' command. Only one of 'mput-filter', 'mput-pattern', or 'mput-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: FTP command.

attributes.name: remote-file-separator
attributes.description: Allows you to provide remote file/directory separator character. DEFAULT: '/'

attributes.name: temporary-file-suffix
attributes.description: Extension used when downloading files. We change it right after we know it's downloaded.

attributes.name: filename-pattern
attributes.description: Allows you to provide file name pattern to determine the file names retrieved by the 'ls' and 'mget' commands and is based on simple pattern matching algorithm (e.g., "*.txt, fo*.txt" etc.) Only one of 'filter', 'filename-pattern', or 'filename-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression representing the path in the command (e.g. ls path to list the files in directory path).

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: temporary-remote-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the remote temporary directory path (e.g., "/remote/temp/mytransfers")

attributes.name: remote-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specify a SpEL expression which will be used to evaluate the directory path to where the files will be transferred (e.g., "headers.['remote_dir'] + '/myTransfers'" for outbound endpoints) There is no root object (message) for inbound endpoints (e.g., "@someBean.fetchDirectory");

attributes.name: local-filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a SpEL expression to generate the file name of the local (transferred) file. The root object of the SpEL evaluation is the request Message, but the name of the original remote file is also provided as the 'remoteFileName' variable. For example, a valid expression would be: "#remoteFileName.toUpperCase() + headers.foo". Only used with 'get' and 'mget' commands.

attributes.name: auto-create-local-directory
attributes.description: Tells this adapter if local directory must be auto-created if it doesn''t exist. Default is TRUE.

attributes.name: request-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the request channel attached to this gateway.

attributes.name: mput-pattern
attributes.description: Allows you to provide file name pattern to determine the file names sent by the 'mput' command and is based on simple pattern matching algorithm (e.g., "*.txt, fo*.txt" etc.) Only one of 'mput-filter', 'mput-pattern', or 'mput-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: command-options
attributes.description: FTP command options; for ls, -1 means just return the file names (otherwise file metadata is returned, -dirs means include directories (not included by default), -links means include links (not included by default); for get, -P means preserve timestamp from remote file.

attributes.name: remote-filename-generator
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to [org.springframework.integration.file.FileNameGenerator] bean.

attributes.name: session-callback
attributes.description: The 'MessageSessionCallback' bean reference to perform custom operation(s) on 'Session' with 'requestMessage'.

attributes.name: local-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specifies SpEL expression to generate the directory path where file will be transferred TO, when using 'get' and 'mget' commands. The root object of the SpEL evaluation is the request Message, but the name of the source remote directory is also provided as the 'remoteDirectory' variable. For example, a valid expression might be: "'/local/' + #remoteDirectory.toUpperCase() + headers.foo". Only used with 'get' and 'mget' commands. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'local-directory'.

attributes.name: reply-timeout
attributes.description: Allows you to specify how long this gateway will wait for the reply message to be sent successfully to the reply channel before throwing an exception. This attribute only applies when the channel might block, for example when using a bounded queue channel that is currently full. Also, keep in mind that when sending to a DirectChannel, the invocation will occur in the sender's thread. Therefore, the failing of the send operation may be caused by other components further downstream. The "reply-timeout" attribute maps to the "sendTimeout" property of the underlying 'MessagingTemplate' instance (org.springframework.integration.core.MessagingTemplate). The attribute will default, if not specified, to '-1', meaning that by default, the Gateway will wait indefinitely. The value is specified in milliseconds.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: This attribute defaults to 'REPLACE' if not set explicitly. The following options are available: APPEND: If append is specified, the data will be appended to the existing file if such file exists, otherwise the new file will be created as usual but, once created, the subsequent data will be appended to it. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the use of a temporary file, since append is done to the actual file and not its temporary counterpart. The file is closed after each write. If set to APPEND, the component will also use instance of the LockRegistry to ensure that there are no collisions when multiple threads are writing to the same file. APPEND_NO_FLUSH: Same as 'APPEND' but the data is not flushed or the file closed. This can significantly improve performance at the risk of lost data in the event of a failure. Various strategies are available for flushing the data and closing the file. Refer to the reference documentation for more information. FAIL: If the target file exists, a MessageHandlingException is thrown. IGNORE: If the target file exists, the message payload is silently ignored. REPLACE: This is the default behavior when writing files. If the target file already exists, it will be overwritten. REPLACE_IF_MODIFIED: If the local file already exists, it will be overwritten only if the last modified timestamp does not match the source timestamp. Only applies to local files.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter acts against the remote server view when using the 'ls' or 'mget' commands. Only one of 'filter', 'filename-pattern', or 'filename-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: reply-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the reply channel attached to this gateway.

attributes.name: temporary-remote-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specify a SpEL expression which will be used to evaluate the temporary directory path to where files will be transferred before they are moved to the remote-directory (e.g., "headers.['remote_dir'] + '/temp/myTransfers'");

attributes.name: working-dir-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate FTP client working directory against request message.

attributes.name: filename-regex
attributes.description: Allows you to provide Regular Expression to determine the file names retrieved by the 'ls' and 'mget' commands. (e.g., "f[o]+\.txt" etc.) Only one of 'filter', 'filename-pattern', or 'filename-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: local-directory
attributes.description: Identifies directory path (e.g., "/local/mytransfers") where file will be transferred TO. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'local-directory-expression'.

attributes.name: remote-filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide SpEL expression which will compute file name of the remote file (e.g., assuming payload is java.io.File "payload.getName() + '.transferred'");

attributes.name: chmod
attributes.description: Change the mode of the file (or remote file) after writing. Integer value expressed in Octal, e.g. '644'.

attributes.name: session-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an [org.springframework.integration.file.remote.session.SessionFactory] bean with an [org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPFile] generic type parameter.

attributes.name: rename-expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression representing the path for the new filename when using the 'mv' command. Defaults to "headers.['file_renameTo']".

attributes.name: filter-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate against file to accept it for processing or not. Mutually exclusive with 'filter' attribute.

attributes.name: use-temporary-file-name
attributes.description: Allows you to suppress using a temporary file name while writing the file.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: remote-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the remote directory path (e.g., "/remote/mytransfers") Mutually exclusive with 'remote-directory-expression'.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy, or when a failure in the delivery to one subscriber should signal that the message should not be sent to subscribers with a higher 'order' attribute. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Allows you to specify Charset (e.g., US-ASCII, ISO-8859-1, UTF-8). [UTF-8] is default - used when converting String payloads to bytes.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.
