attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

groovy.name: control-bus
groovy.description: Control bus ('org.springframework.integration.groovy.config.GroovyControlBusFactoryBean') that accepts messages in the form of Groovy scripts. The scripts should be provided as String payload in incoming messages. The variable bindings will include any @ManagedResource, Lifecycle, or CustomizableThreadCreator instances from within the ApplicationContext.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: customizer
attributes.description: Reference to a GroovyObjectCustomizer bean to be applied to each script payload.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

groovy.name: script
groovy.description: Configures an inner bean ('org.springframework.integration.groovy.GroovyScriptExecutingMessageProcessor') that will generate a Groovy Script.

attributes.name: compile-static
attributes.description: Indicates if the target Groovy script should be compiled statically. The @CompileStatic hint is applied for the Groovy compiler. This attribute is ignored if the 'compiler-configuration' reference is specified.

attributes.name: customizer
attributes.description: Reference to a GroovyObjectCustomizer bean to be applied to this script.

attributes.name: refresh-check-delay
attributes.description: Refresh delay for the script contents if specified as a resource location (defaults to -1, never refresh).

attributes.name: variables
attributes.description: Comma-delimited pairs of variables and their values. the variable name can applies '-ref' suffix, which mean to determine a variable value as a bean reference. This attribute isn't mutually exclusive with 'variable' sub-elements and all variables will be merged to one Map. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'script-variable-generator' attribute.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: Resource location path for the Script. Either this or an inline script as body text should be provided, but not both.

attributes.name: script-variable-generator
attributes.description: Reference to the ScriptVariableGenerator bean. This attribute is mutually exclusive with any 'variable' sub-elements and 'variables' attribute.

attributes.name: compiler-configuration
attributes.description: Reference to a CompilerConfiguration bean to be applied to the underlying GroovyClassLoader for this script compilation.

children.name: variable
children.description: Allows you to define custom script variable bindings. The use of this sub-element is mutually exclusive with the 'script-variable-generator' attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the script variable as a literal.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Value of the script variable as a bean reference.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the script variable.

http.name: outbound-channel-adapter
http.description: Configures a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.http.outbound.HttpRequestExecutingMessageHandler' with 'expectReply = false' that sends HTTP requests based on incoming messages.

attributes.name: header-mapper
attributes.description: Specify a reference to org.springframework.integration.mapping.HeaderMapper implementation bean. Only one of 'header-mapper' or 'mapped-request-headers' attributes can be provided.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. Depending on the type of the adapter this channel could be the receiving channel (e.g., outbound-channel-adapter) or channel where messages will be sent to by this adapter (e.g., inbound-channel-adapter).

attributes.name: encode-uri
attributes.description: When set to "false", the real URI won't be encoded before the request is sent. This may be useful in some scenarios as it allows user control over the encoding, if needed, for example by using the "url-expression". Default is "true".

attributes.name: extract-payload
attributes.description: Specify whether the outbound message's payload should be extracted when preparing the request body. Otherwise the Message instance itself will be serialized. The default value is 'true'.

attributes.name: uri-variables-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the SpEL expression to be evaluate as a Map for URI variable placeholders within 'url'. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'uri-variable' sub-elements.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: message-converters
attributes.description: Provide a reference to a list of HttpMessageConverter instances. If specified, these converters will replace all of the default converters that would normally be present on the underlying RestTemplate.

attributes.name: http-method
attributes.description: The HTTP method to use when executing requests with this adapter Default is POST. This attribute cannot be provided if http-method-expression has a value.

attributes.name: rest-template
attributes.description: The reference to org.springframework.web.client.RestTemplate bean to send the HTTP Request.

attributes.name: expected-response-type
attributes.description: The expected type to which the response body should be converted. Default is 'org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity'. This attribute cannot be provided if expected-response-type-expression has a value

attributes.name: mapped-request-headers
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of names of MessageHeaders to be mapped into the HttpHeaders of the HTTP request. This can only be provided if the 'header-mapper' reference is not being set directly. The values in this list can also be simple patterns to be matched against the header names (e.g. "foo*" or "*foo"). The String "HTTP_REQUEST_HEADERS" will match against any of the standard HTTP Request headers.

attributes.name: error-handler
attributes.description: Reference to a ResponseErrorHandler to be used by the underlying RestTemplate.

attributes.name: trusted-spel
attributes.description: Set to 'true' if you trust SpEL expressions that might be evaluated to generate URI variables. The default value is 'false'.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: URL to which the requests should be sent. It may include {placeholders} for evaluation against uri-variables.

attributes.name: request-factory
attributes.description: Reference to a ClientHttpRequestFactory to be used by the underlying RestTemplate.

attributes.name: http-method-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to determine HTTP method, use when executing requests with this adapter, dynamically. This attribute cannot be provided if http-method has a value.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Specify the charset name to use for converting String-typed payloads to bytes. The default is 'UTF-8'

attributes.name: expected-response-type-expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression to determine the type for the expected response to which the response body should be converted The returned value of the expression could be an instance of java.lang.Class or java.lang.String representing a fully qualified class name. This attribute cannot be provided if expected-response-type has a value

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this adapter is connected as a subscriber to a SubscribableChannel.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: url-expression
attributes.description: SpEL Expression resolving to a URL to which the requests should be sent. The resolved value may include {placeholders} for further evaluation against uri-variables.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

children.name: uri-variable
children.description: Specify an expression for URI variable placeholder within 'url'. This element is mutually exclusive with 'uri-variables-expression' attribute.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to determine the replacement value. The Message is the root object of the expression, therefore the 'payload' and 'headers' are available directly. Any bean may be resolved if the bean name is preceded with '@'.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the placeholder to be replaced.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

http.name: inbound-gateway
http.description: Configures a Messaging Gateway Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.http.inbound.HttpRequestHandlingEndpointSupport' that receives HTTP requests and produces responses.

attributes.name: reply-timeout-status-code-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression that resolves to an 'HttpStatus' code when rendering a response after a 'reply-timeout'. The expression must return an object which can be converted to a 'org.springframework.http.HttpStatus' enum value. The 'evaluationContext' has a 'BeanResolver' but no variables, so the usage of this attribute is somewhat limited. An example might be to resolve, at runtime, some scoped Bean that returns an 'HttpStatus' value, or use a literal expression e.g. "504". By default 'status-code-expression' is null, meaning that the default '500 Internal Server Error' response status will be returned after a timeout. When a timeout is not encountered, the 'http:inbound-gateway' resolves the 'status code' from the 'http_statusCode' header of the reply Message.

attributes.name: header-mapper
attributes.description: Specifies a reference to org.springframework.integration.mapping.HeaderMapper implementation bean. Only one of 'header-mapper' or 'mapped-request-headers' attributes can be provided.

attributes.name: mapped-response-headers
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of names of MessageHeaders to be mapped into the HttpHeaders of the HTTP response. This can only be provided if the 'header-mapper' reference is not being set directly. The values in this list can also be simple patterns to be matched against the header names (e.g. "foo*" or "*foo"). The String "HTTP_RESPONSE_HEADERS" will match against any of the standard HTTP Response headers.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: view-expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression that resolves to a view to be resolved when rendering a response. The expression can resolve to a view name or View object. In the case of 'inbound-gateway' the root object of the evaluation context is the reply message. In the case of 'inbound-channel-adapter' the 'evaluationContext' for this expression is rather lightweight, because there is no reply message, it has a 'BeanResolver' but no variables, so the usage of this attribute is somewhat limited. An example might be to resolve, at runtime, some scoped Bean that returns a view name or View object. This attribute is not allowed if there is a 'view-name' attribute.

attributes.name: validator
attributes.description: A 'Validator' bean reference to validate a payload converted from the HTTP request.

attributes.name: request-timeout
attributes.description: Used to set the sendTimeout on the underlying MessagingTemplate instance (org.springframework.integration.core.MessagingTemplate) for sending messages to the request channel. If not specified this property will default to "1000" (1 second).

attributes.name: errors-key
attributes.description: In the case that a view-name is specified this attribute can be used to override the default key of the Errors (if the request cannot be handled). Defaults to "errors" (similar to normal MVC usage).

attributes.name: extract-reply-payload
attributes.description: Specify whether only the reply Message's payload should be passed in the response. If this is set to 'false', the entire Message will be used to generate the response. The default is 'true'.

attributes.name: request-payload-type
attributes.description: Target type for payload that is the conversion result of the request.

attributes.name: reply-timeout
attributes.description: Used to set the receiveTimeout on the underlying MessagingTemplate instance (org.springframework.integration.core.MessagingTemplate) for receiving messages from the reply channel. If not specified this property will default to "1000" (1 second).

attributes.name: reply-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the channel to which this gateway will subscribe, to receive(send) reply Messages.

attributes.name: supported-methods
attributes.description: Comma-separated HTTP Method names. Determines which types of Request are allowed with this Endpoint.

attributes.name: error-code
attributes.description: In the case that a view-name is specified this attribute can be used to override the default error code under which the handling exception is exposed. Defaults to "spring.integration.http.handler.error" and is supplied with 3 parameters: the exception itself, its message and its stack trace as a String.

attributes.name: convert-exceptions
attributes.description: In the case that a view-name is not specified this attribute can be used to override the default behaviour when there is a message handling exception (which is to rethrow). If this flag is true then the normal conversion process will be applied to the exception and written out to the response body.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: The MessagingGateway's 'error-channel' where to send an ErrorMessage in case of Exception is caused from original message flow.

attributes.name: message-converters
attributes.description: List of HttpMessageConverters for this Channel Adapter.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: Comma-separated URI paths (e.g., /orderId/{order}). Ant-style path patterns are also supported (e.g. /myPath/*.do).

attributes.name: reply-key
attributes.description: In the case that a view-name is specified this attribute can be used to override the default key of the MVC Controller's ModelAndView attribute to keep a reply from underlying message flow. Default is 'reply'.

attributes.name: payload-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to specify SpEL expression to construct a Message payload

attributes.name: view-name
attributes.description: View name to be resolved when rendering a response.

attributes.name: mapped-request-headers
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of names of HttpHeaders to be mapped from the HTTP request into the MessageHeaders. This can only be provided if the 'header-mapper' reference is not being set directly. The values in this list can also be simple patterns to be matched against the header names (e.g. "foo*" or "*foo"). The String "HTTP_REQUEST_HEADERS" will match against any of the standard HTTP Request headers.

attributes.name: merge-with-default-converters
attributes.description: Flag to indicate if the default converters should be registered after any custom converters. This flag is used only if message-converters are provided, otherwise all default converters will be registered. Defaults to "false"

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: request-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message Channel of this endpoint.

children.name: request-mapping
children.description: Defines configuration for org.springframework.integration.http.inbound.RequestMapping as RESTFul attributes for Spring Integration HTTP Inbound Endpoints.

attributes.name: produces
attributes.description: The producible media types of the mapped request, narrowing the primary mapping. The format is a sequence of media types ("text/plain", "application/*), with a request only mapped if the Accept matches one of these media types. Expressions can be negated by using the "!" operator, as in "!text/plain", which matches all requests with a Accept other than "text/plain".

attributes.name: headers
attributes.description: The headers of the mapped request, narrowing the primary mapping. A sequence of "My-Header=myValue" style expressions, with a request only mapped if each such header is found to have the given value. Expressions can be negated by using the "!=" operator, as in "My-Header!=myValue". "My-Header" style expressions are also supported, with such headers having to be present in the request (allowed to have any value). "!My-Header" style expressions indicate that the specified header is not supposed to be present in the request. Also supports media type wildcards (*), for headers such as Accept and Content-Type. For instance, headers = "content-type=text/*" will match requests with a Content-Type of "text/html", "text/plain", etc.

attributes.name: params
attributes.description: The parameters of the mapped request, narrowing the primary mapping. A sequence of "myParam=myValue" style expressions, with a request only mapped if each such parameter is found to have the given value. Expressions can be negated by using the "!=" operator, as in "myParam!=myValue". "myParam" style expressions are also supported, with such parameters having to be present in the request (allowed to have any value). "!myParam" style expressions indicate that the specified parameter is not supposed to be present in the request.

attributes.name: consumes
attributes.description: The consumable media types of the mapped request, narrowing the primary mapping. The format is a sequence of media types ("text/plain", "application/*), with a request only mapped if the Content-Type matches one of these media types. Expressions can be negated by using the "!" operator, as in "!text/plain", which matches all requests with a Content-Type other than "text/plain".

children.name: cross-origin
children.description: Marks this endpoint as permitting cross origin requests (CORS).

attributes.name: exposed-headers
attributes.description: List of response headers that the user-agent will allow the client to access. This property controls the value of actual response's 'Access-Control-Expose-Headers' header.

attributes.name: max-age
attributes.description: Controls the cache duration for pre-flight responses. Setting this to a reasonable value can reduce the number of pre-flight request/response interaction required by the browser. This property controls the value of the 'Access-Control-Max-Age' header in the pre-flight response. Value set to '-1' means undefined. Default value is 1800 seconds, or 30 minutes.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: The HTTP request methods to allow: GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, TRACE. Methods specified here overrides 'supported-methods' ones.

attributes.name: allowed-headers
attributes.description: Indicates which request headers can be used during the actual request. "*" means that all headers asked by the client are allowed. This property controls the value of pre-flight response's 'Access-Control-Allow-Headers' header. Default value is "*".

attributes.name: allow-credentials
attributes.description: Set to "true" if the the browser should include any cookies associated to the domain of the request being annotated, or "false" if it should not. Empty string "" means undefined. If true, the pre-flight response will include the header 'Access-Control-Allow-Credentials=true'. Default value is "true".

attributes.name: origin
attributes.description: List of allowed origins. "*" means that all origins are allowed. These values are placed in the 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header of both the pre-flight and actual responses. Default value is "*".

children.name: header
children.description: Specifies a Message header as a result of expression evaluation against ServletRequest and URI Variables.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to determine the value of the header.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the Message Header

http.name: graph-controller
http.description: Configures a 'org.springframework.integration.http.management.IntegrationGraphController' bean to expose a REST API for the 'org.springframework.integration.support.management.graph.IntegrationGraphServer' bean. Note: Spring Web MVC must be present in the application to enable and register this component.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The root request mapping path for the 'IntegrationGraphController'. Defaults to /integration.

http.name: inbound-channel-adapter
http.description: Configures a Message Producing Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.http.inbound.HttpRequestHandlingEndpointSupport' that receives HTTP requests and doesn't produce responses.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a message to the channel if such channel may block. For example, a Queue Channel can block until space is available if its maximum capacity has been reached.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. Depending on the type of the adapter this channel could be the receiving channel (e.g., outbound-channel-adapter) or channel where messages will be sent to by this adapter (e.g., inbound-channel-adapter).

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: Comma-separated URI paths (e.g., /orderId/{order}). Ant-style path patterns are also supported (e.g. /myPath/*.do).

attributes.name: payload-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to specify SpEL expression to construct a Message payload

attributes.name: header-mapper
attributes.description: Specifies a reference to org.springframework.integration.mapping.HeaderMapper implementation bean. Only one of 'header-mapper' or 'mapped-request-headers' attributes can be provided.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: view-expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression that resolves to a view to be resolved when rendering a response. The expression can resolve to a view name or View object. In the case of 'inbound-gateway' the root object of the evaluation context is the reply message. In the case of 'inbound-channel-adapter' the 'evaluationContext' for this expression is rather lightweight, because there is no reply message, it has a 'BeanResolver' but no variables, so the usage of this attribute is somewhat limited. An example might be to resolve, at runtime, some scoped Bean that returns a view name or View object. This attribute is not allowed if there is a 'view-name' attribute.

attributes.name: validator
attributes.description: A 'Validator' bean reference to validate a payload converted from the HTTP request.

attributes.name: status-code-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression that resolves to an 'HttpStatus' code when rendering a response. The expression must return an object which can be converted to a 'org.springframework.http.HttpStatus' enum value. The 'evaluationContext' has a 'BeanResolver' but no variables, so the usage of this attribute is somewhat limited. An example might be to resolve, at runtime, some scoped Bean that returns an 'HttpStatus' value, or use a literal expression e.g. "201". By default 'status-code-expression' is null, meaning that the default '200 OK' response status will be returned. The 'http:inbound-gateway' resolves the 'status code' from the 'http_statusCode' header of the reply Message.

attributes.name: view-name
attributes.description: View name to be resolved when rendering a response.

attributes.name: errors-key
attributes.description: In the case that a view-name is specified this attribute can be used to override the default key of the Errors (if the request cannot be handled). Defaults to "errors" (similar to normal MVC usage).

attributes.name: mapped-request-headers
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of names of HttpHeaders to be mapped from the HTTP request into the MessageHeaders. This can only be provided if the 'header-mapper' reference is not being set directly. The values in this list can also be simple patterns to be matched against the header names (e.g. "foo*" or "*foo"). The String "HTTP_REQUEST_HEADERS" will match against any of the standard HTTP Request headers.

attributes.name: request-payload-type
attributes.description: Target type for payload that is the conversion result of the request.

attributes.name: merge-with-default-converters
attributes.description: Flag to indicate if the default converters should be registered after any custom converters. This flag is used only if message-converters are provided, otherwise all default converters will be registered. Defaults to "false"

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: error-code
attributes.description: In the case that a view-name is specified this attribute can be used to override the default error code under which the handling exception is exposed. Defaults to "spring.integration.http.handler.error" and is supplied with 3 parameters: the exception itself, its message and its stack trace as a String.

attributes.name: supported-methods
attributes.description: Comma-separated HTTP Method names. Determines which types of Request are allowed with this Endpoint.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: The MessagingGateway's 'error-channel' where to send an ErrorMessage in case of Exception is caused from original message flow.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: message-converters
attributes.description: List of HttpMessageConverters for this Channel Adapter.

children.name: request-mapping
children.description: Defines configuration for org.springframework.integration.http.inbound.RequestMapping as RESTFul attributes for Spring Integration HTTP Inbound Endpoints.

attributes.name: headers
attributes.description: The headers of the mapped request, narrowing the primary mapping. A sequence of "My-Header=myValue" style expressions, with a request only mapped if each such header is found to have the given value. Expressions can be negated by using the "!=" operator, as in "My-Header!=myValue". "My-Header" style expressions are also supported, with such headers having to be present in the request (allowed to have any value). "!My-Header" style expressions indicate that the specified header is not supposed to be present in the request. Also supports media type wildcards (*), for headers such as Accept and Content-Type. For instance, headers = "content-type=text/*" will match requests with a Content-Type of "text/html", "text/plain", etc.

attributes.name: params
attributes.description: The parameters of the mapped request, narrowing the primary mapping. A sequence of "myParam=myValue" style expressions, with a request only mapped if each such parameter is found to have the given value. Expressions can be negated by using the "!=" operator, as in "myParam!=myValue". "myParam" style expressions are also supported, with such parameters having to be present in the request (allowed to have any value). "!myParam" style expressions indicate that the specified parameter is not supposed to be present in the request.

attributes.name: consumes
attributes.description: The consumable media types of the mapped request, narrowing the primary mapping. The format is a sequence of media types ("text/plain", "application/*), with a request only mapped if the Content-Type matches one of these media types. Expressions can be negated by using the "!" operator, as in "!text/plain", which matches all requests with a Content-Type other than "text/plain".

children.name: cross-origin
children.description: Marks this endpoint as permitting cross origin requests (CORS).

attributes.name: exposed-headers
attributes.description: List of response headers that the user-agent will allow the client to access. This property controls the value of actual response's 'Access-Control-Expose-Headers' header.

attributes.name: max-age
attributes.description: Controls the cache duration for pre-flight responses. Setting this to a reasonable value can reduce the number of pre-flight request/response interaction required by the browser. This property controls the value of the 'Access-Control-Max-Age' header in the pre-flight response. Value set to '-1' means undefined. Default value is 1800 seconds, or 30 minutes.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: The HTTP request methods to allow: GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, TRACE. Methods specified here overrides 'supported-methods' ones.

attributes.name: allowed-headers
attributes.description: Indicates which request headers can be used during the actual request. "*" means that all headers asked by the client are allowed. This property controls the value of pre-flight response's 'Access-Control-Allow-Headers' header. Default value is "*".

attributes.name: allow-credentials
attributes.description: Set to "true" if the the browser should include any cookies associated to the domain of the request being annotated, or "false" if it should not. Empty string "" means undefined. If true, the pre-flight response will include the header 'Access-Control-Allow-Credentials=true'. Default value is "true".

attributes.name: origin
attributes.description: List of allowed origins. "*" means that all origins are allowed. These values are placed in the 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header of both the pre-flight and actual responses. Default value is "*".

children.name: header
children.description: Specifies a Message header as a result of expression evaluation against ServletRequest and URI Variables.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to determine the value of the header.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the Message Header

http.name: outbound-gateway
http.description: Configures a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.http.outbound.HttpRequestExecutingMessageHandler' that sends HTTP requests based on incoming messages and expects HTTP responses.

attributes.name: encode-uri
attributes.description: When set to "false", the real URI won't be encoded before the request is sent. This may be useful in some scenarios as it allows user control over the encoding, if needed, for example by using the "url-expression". Default is "true".

attributes.name: message-converters
attributes.description: Provide a reference to a list of HttpMessageConverter instances. If specified, these converters will replace all of the default converters that would normally be present on the underlying RestTemplate.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: http-method
attributes.description: The HTTP method to use when executing requests with this adapter Default is POST. This attribute cannot be provided if http-method-expression has a value.

attributes.name: mapped-request-headers
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of names of MessageHeaders to be mapped into the HttpHeaders of the HTTP request. This can only be provided if the 'header-mapper' reference is not being set directly. The values in this list can also be simple patterns to be matched against the header names (e.g. "foo*" or "*foo"). The String "HTTP_REQUEST_HEADERS" will match against any of the standard HTTP Request headers.

attributes.name: error-handler
attributes.description: Reference to a ResponseErrorHandler to be used by the underlying RestTemplate.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Specify the charset name to use for converting String-typed payloads to bytes. The default is 'UTF-8'

attributes.name: reply-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the channel to which this gateway will subscribe, to receive(send) reply Messages.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this adapter is connected as a subscriber to a SubscribableChannel.

attributes.name: url-expression
attributes.description: SpEL Expression resolving to a URL to which the requests should be sent. The resolved value may include {placeholders} for further evaluation against uri-variables.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: header-mapper
attributes.description: Specify a reference to org.springframework.integration.mapping.HeaderMapper implementation bean. Only one of 'header-mapper' or 'mapped-request-headers' attributes can be provided.

attributes.name: reply-timeout
attributes.description: Allows you to specify how long this gateway will wait for the reply message to be sent successfully to the reply channel before throwing an exception. This attribute only applies when the channel might block, for example when using a bounded queue channel that is currently full. Also, keep in mind that when sending to a DirectChannel, the invocation will occur in the sender's thread. Therefore, the failing of the send operation may be caused by other components further downstream. The "reply-timeout" attribute maps to the "sendTimeout" property of the underlying 'MessagingTemplate' instance (org.springframework.integration.core.MessagingTemplate). The attribute will default, if not specified, to '-1', meaning that by default, the Gateway will wait indefinitely. The value is specified in milliseconds.

attributes.name: mapped-response-headers
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of names of HttpHeaders to be mapped from the HTTP response into the MessageHeaders. This can only be provided if the 'header-mapper' reference is not being set directly. The values in this list can also be simple patterns to be matched against the header names (e.g. "foo*" or "*foo"). The String "HTTP_RESPONSE_HEADERS" will match against any of the standard HTTP Response headers.

attributes.name: uri-variables-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the SpEL expression to be evaluate as a Map for URI variable placeholders within 'url'. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'uri-variable' sub-elements.

attributes.name: rest-template
attributes.description: The reference to org.springframework.web.client.RestTemplate bean to send the HTTP Request.

attributes.name: expected-response-type
attributes.description: The expected type to which the response body should be converted. Default is 'org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity'. This attribute cannot be provided if expected-response-type-expression has a value

attributes.name: trusted-spel
attributes.description: Set to 'true' if you trust SpEL expressions that might be evaluated to generate URI variables. The default value is 'false'.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: URL to which the requests should be sent. It may include {placeholders} for evaluation against uri-variables.

attributes.name: request-factory
attributes.description: Reference to a ClientHttpRequestFactory to be used by the underlying RestTemplate.

attributes.name: http-method-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to determine HTTP method, use when executing requests with this adapter, dynamically. This attribute cannot be provided if http-method has a value.

attributes.name: transfer-cookies
attributes.description: When set to "true", if a response contains a 'Set-Cookie' header, it will be mapped to a 'Cookie' header. This enables simple cookie handling where subsequent HTTP interactions in the same message flow can use a cookie supplied by the server. Default is "false".

attributes.name: extract-request-payload
attributes.description: Specifies whether the outbound message's payload should be extracted when preparing the request body. Otherwise the Message instance itself will be serialized. The default value is 'true'.

attributes.name: expected-response-type-expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression to determine the type for the expected response to which the response body should be converted The returned value of the expression could be an instance of java.lang.Class or java.lang.String representing a fully qualified class name. This attribute cannot be provided if expected-response-type has a value

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: request-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message Channel of this endpoint.

children.name: uri-variable
children.description: Specify an expression for URI variable placeholder within 'url'.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to determine the replacement value. The Message is the root object of the expression, therefore the 'payload' and 'headers' are available directly. Any bean may be resolved if the bean name is preceded with '@'.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the placeholder to be replaced.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

integration.name: filter
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.filter.MessageFilter' that is used to decide whether a Message should be passed along or dropped based on some criteria

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by 'ref' attribute

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the handler. The bean can be an implementation of the MessageHandler interface or a POJO

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.name: discard-channel
attributes.description: The channel where the filter will send the messages that were dropped

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to be evaluated against the input Message as its root object.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: throw-exception-on-rejection
attributes.description: Throw an exception if the filter rejects the message (default false).

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: 'id' value: - Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (AbstractEndpoint) - as MessageHandler bean alias together with suffix '.handler'

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines the configuration metadata for a poller.

If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

integration.name: service-activator
integration.description: Defines an endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.handler.ServiceActivatingHandler' for exposing any bean reference as a service that receives request Messages from an 'input-channel' and may send reply Messages to an 'output-channel'. The 'ref' may point to an instance that has either a single public method or a method with the @ServiceActivator annotation. Otherwise, the 'method' attribute should be provided along with 'ref'.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by 'ref' attribute

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: If set to 'true', a reply must return a non-null value. By setting 'requires-reply' to 'true', a 'ReplyRequiredException' will be raised for null reply messages. If 'requires-reply' is set to false, those messages are silently dropped. This attribute defaults to 'true' for 'transformer'.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the handler. The bean can be an implementation of the MessageHandler interface or a POJO

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to be evaluated against the input Message as its root object.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: async
attributes.description: If the service method returns a ListenableFuture<?> and this flag is 'true', the calling thread is released immediately. The remaining flow will run on the thread that completes the future. If 'false' (default), the future will be sent as the payload of the result message. This has no effect with any other type of return.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: not-propagated-headers
attributes.description: Header patterns ("xxx*", "*xxx", "*xxx*" or "xxx*yyy") that will NOT be copied from the inbound message. '*' means do not copy headers at all.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: 'id' value: - Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (AbstractEndpoint) - as MessageHandler bean alias together with suffix '.handler'

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines the configuration metadata for a poller.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: The reference to an ExpressionSource.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: The key for retrieving the expression from an ExpressionSource.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

integration.name: claim-check-in
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.transformer.ClaimCheckInTransformer' that stores a Message and returns a new Message, whose payload is the id of the stored Message.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: message-store
attributes.description: Reference to the MessageStore to be used by this Claim Check transformer. If not specified, the default reference will be to a bean named 'messageStore'.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.
