attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

attributes.name: stats-enabled-patterns
attributes.description: Comma separated list of simple patterns for component names for which message statistics will be enabled (response times, rates etc), as well as counts (a positive match here overrides `counts-enabled`, you can't have statistics without counts). (defaults to '*'). Only patterns that also match 'managed-components' will be considered. Enables statistics for those components that support statistics (channels - when sending, message handlers, etc). This is the initial setting only, individual components can have stats enabled/disabled at runtime. If a pattern starts with `!`, stats (and counts) are disabled for matches. Note: this means that '!foo' here will disable stats and counts for 'foo' even if counts are enabled for 'foo' in 'counts-enabled'. For components with names that match multiple patterns, the first pattern wins. Enabling stats at runtime also enables counts.

attributes.name: default-counts-enabled
attributes.description: The default value for components that don't match 'counts-enabled-patterns'. Defaults to false, or true when an Integration MBean Exporter is provided.

attributes.name: metrics-factory
attributes.description: A MetricsFactory responsible for creating objects that maintain metrics for message channels and message handlers.

attributes.name: default-stats-enabled
attributes.description: The default value for components that don't match 'stats-enabled-patterns'. Defaults to false, or true when an Integration MBean Exporter is provided.

attributes.name: counts-enabled-patterns
attributes.description: Comma separated list of simple patterns for component names for which message counts will be enabled (defaults to '*'). Only patterns that also match 'managed-components' will be considered. Enables message counting (`sendCount`, `errorCount`, `receiveCount`) for those components that support counters (channels, message handlers, etc). This is the initial setting only, individual components can have counts enabled/disabled at runtime. May be overridden by an entry in 'stats-enabled' which is additional functionality over simple counts. If a pattern starts with `!`, counts are disabled for matches. For components with names that match multiple patterns, the first pattern wins. Disabling counts at runtime also disables stats.

attributes.name: default-logging-enabled
attributes.description: Set false, to disable all main-path debug logging for components that implement 'IntegrationManagement' (channels, message handlers etc). For high-volume environments avoiding calls to 'isDebuggingEnabled()` can improve performance.

integration.name: scatter-gather
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.scattergather.ScatterGatherHandler'.

attributes.name: gather-timeout
attributes.description: Allows to specify how long the Scatter-Gather will wait for reply Messages for gathering. By default it will wait indefinitely. Value is specified in milliseconds.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: gather-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the channel to receive reply Messages for gathering.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: scatter-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the channel to send a message for 'auction' Scatter-Gather pattern variant. Mutually exclusive with 'scatterer' sub-element.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: Specify whether the Scatter-Gather must return a non-null value. This value is 'true' by default, hence a ReplyRequiredException will be thrown when the underlying aggregator returns a null value after 'gather-timeout'. Note, if 'null' is a possibility, the 'gather-timeout' should be specified to avoid an indefinite wait.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: 'id' value: - Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (AbstractEndpoint) - as MessageHandler bean alias together with suffix '.handler' - as a RecipientListRouter bean together with suffix '.scatterer' - as a AggregatingMessageHandler bean together with suffix '.gatherer'

attributes.name: apply-sequence
attributes.description: Specify whether sequence number and size headers should be added to each Message. Defaults to false.

attributes.name: ignore-send-failures
attributes.description: If set to "true", failures to send to a message channel will be ignored. If set to "false", a MessageDeliveryException will be thrown instead, and if the router resolves more than one channel, any subsequent channels will not receive the message. Please be aware that when using direct channels (single threaded), send-failures can be caused by exceptions thrown by components much further down-stream. This attribute defaults to false.

attributes.name: default-output-channel
attributes.description: Reference to the channel where Messages should be sent if channel resolution fails to return any channels. If no default output channel is provided, the router will throw an Exception. If you would like to silently drop those messages instead, add the "nullChannel" as the default output channel attribute value.

attributes.name: resolution-required
attributes.description: Specify whether channel names must always be successfully resolved to existing channel instances. If set to 'true', a MessagingException will be raised in case the channel cannot be resolved. Setting this attribute to 'false', will cause any unresolvable channels to be ignored. If not explicitly set, 'resolution-required' will default to 'true'.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending Messages to the target MessageChannels if blocking is possible (e.g. a bounded queue channel that is currently full). By default the send will block indefinitely. Synonym for 'timeout' - only one can be supplied.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition which in case of Routers is an instance of EventDrivenConsumer or PollingConsumer depending on whether the Router's "input-channel" is a "SubscribableChannel" or "PollableChannel", respectively. This is an "optional" attribute.

children.name: recipient
children.description: An expression to be evaluated to determine if this recipient should be included in the recipient list for a given input Message. The evaluation result of the expression must be a boolean. If this attribute is not defined, the channel will always be among the list of recipients.

attributes.name: selector-expression
attributes.description: An expression to be evaluated to determine if this recipient should be included in the recipient list for a given input Message. The evaluation result of the expression must be a boolean. If this attribute is not defined, the channel will always be among the list of recipients.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: The channel (recepient) that the message will be send to.

attributes.name: correlation-strategy
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the decision algorithm as to whether a given message group is complete. The bean can be an implementation of the CorrelationStrategy interface or a POJO.

attributes.name: expire-groups-upon-timeout
attributes.description: Boolean flag specifying, if a group is completed due to timeout (reaper or 'group-timeout(-expression)'), whether the group should be removed. When true, late arriving messages will form a new group. When false, they will be discarded. Default is 'true' for an aggregator and 'false' for a resequencer.

attributes.name: group-timeout-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to evaluate a 'group-timeout' with the MessageGroup as the #root evaluation context object for scheduling the MessageGroup forced completion, when the 'ReleaseStrategy' does not 'release' the group when the current Message arrives. If 'group-timeout-expression' evaluates to 'null' or less than '0', the MessageGroup won't be scheduled to be forced complete. The action taken when the group is forced complete depends on the 'send-partial-result-on-expiry' attribute. Mutually exclusive with the 'group-timeout' attribute.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by 'ref' attribute

attributes.name: lock-registry
attributes.description: A reference to a 'org.springframework.integration.support.locks.LockRegistry' bean to obtain 'java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock' by 'groupId'. Used for concurrent operations on MessageGroups. By default an internal 'DefaultLockRegistry' is used.

attributes.name: message-store
attributes.description: Reference to a MessageGroupStore for holding state in between message processing. The default is to use a volatile in-memory store, which means that unprocessed messages will be lost if the JVM exits. To customize the expiry of incomplete message groups configure the message store.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the handler. The bean can be an implementation of the MessageHandler interface or a POJO

attributes.name: release-strategy-method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by release-strategy, that implements the completion decision algorithm.

attributes.name: group-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout in milliseconds to force the MessageGroup complete, when the 'ReleaseStrategy' does not 'release' the group when the current Message arrives. If 'group-timeout' is not provided or is less than '0' the MessageGroup won't be scheduled to be forced complete. The action taken when the group is forced complete depends on the 'send-partial-result-on-expiry' attribute. Mutually exclusive with the 'group-timeout-expression' attribute.

attributes.name: release-lock-before-send
attributes.description: Set to true to release the message group lock before sending any output. See "Avoiding Deadlocks" in the Aggregator section of the reference manual for more information as to why this might be needed.

attributes.name: headers-function
attributes.description: A reference to the 'Function' for merging and computing message headers for reply based on the 'MessageGroup' to release.

attributes.name: expire-groups-upon-completion
attributes.description: Boolean flag specifying if MessageGroup should be removed once completed. Useful for handling late arrival use cases where messages arriving with the correlationKey that is the same as the completed MessageGroup will be discarded. Default is 'false'

attributes.name: send-partial-result-on-expiry
attributes.description: Specifies whether messages that expired should be aggregated and sent to the 'output-channel' or 'replyChannel'. Messages are expired when their containing MessageGroup expires. One of the ways of expiring MessageGroups is by configuring a MessageGroupStoreReaper. However MessageGroups can alternatively be expired by simply calling MessageGroupStore.expireMessageGroups(timeout). That could be accomplished via a ControlBus operation or by simply invoking that method if you have a reference to the MessageGroupStore instance.

attributes.name: correlation-strategy-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression which implements correlation decision algorithm to apply to the Message (e.g., payload.getPerson().getId() - correlate based on the 'id' of the 'person' attribute of the message payload object)

attributes.name: discard-channel
attributes.description: The channel where the aggregator will send the messages that timed out (if send-partial-results- on-expiry is 'false').

attributes.name: release-strategy
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the release strategy. The bean can be an implementation of the ReleaseStrategy interface or a POJO

attributes.name: release-strategy-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to evaluate against a root object that is the Collection of messages within the message group (e.g, size() > 6)

attributes.name: empty-group-min-timeout
attributes.description: Empty groups exist after a group is released normally. This is to enable the detection and discarding of late-arriving messages. If you wish to run empty group deletion on a longer schedule than expiring partial groups, set this property. Empty groups will then not be removed from the MessageStore until they have not been modified for at least this number of milliseconds. If this is set, the group is scheduled for removal after normal or partial sequences group release. When a MessageGroupStoreReaper is configured to expire partial groups, empty groups are also removed, but using this value. Note that the actual time to expire an empty group will also be affected by the reaper's 'timeout' property and it could be as much as this value plus the timeout.

attributes.name: scheduler
attributes.description: Provide a reference to the TaskScheduler instance to schedule 'forceComplete' on the MessageGroup when no new message arrives for the MessageGroup within the 'group-timeout' or 'group-timeout-expression'. If it isn't provided, the default scheduler 'taskScheduler', registered in the ApplicationContext {ThreadPoolTaskScheduler} will be used. This attribute only applies if 'group-timeout' or 'group-timeout-expression' is specified.

attributes.name: pop-sequence
attributes.description: Boolean flag specifying, if the 'MessageBuilder.popSequenceDetails()' should be called for the output message. Plays the opposite role to the 'AbstractMessageSplitter.setApplySequence()'. Defaults to 'true'.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: 'id' value: - Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (AbstractEndpoint) - as MessageHandler bean alias together with suffix '.handler'

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to be evaluated against the input message list as its root object.

attributes.name: correlation-strategy-method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by correlation-strategy, that implements the correlation decision algorithm

Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

integration.name: gateway
integration.description: Defines a Messaging Gateway - 'org.springframework.integration.gateway.GatewayProxyFactoryBean'.

attributes.name: default-payload-expression
attributes.description: An expression that will be used to generate the payload for all methods in the service interface unless explicitly overridden by a method declaration. Variables include #args, #gatewayMethod; a bean resolver is also available, enabling expressions like "@someBean(#args)".

attributes.name: default-request-timeout
attributes.description: Provides the amount of time dispatcher would wait to send a message. This timeout would only apply if there is a potential to block in the send call. For example if this gateway is hooked up to a Queue channel. Value is specified in milliseconds; it can be a simple long value or a SpEL expression; array variable #args is available.

attributes.name: async-executor
attributes.description: Provide a reference to an implementation of java.util.concurrent.Executor to use for any of the interface methods that have a Future or ListenableFuture return type. This Executor will only be used for those async methods; the sync methods will be invoked on the caller's thread. By default, a SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor is used. Most executors return a FutureTask or FutureListenableTask respectively but a custom executor can return any Future. If the method return type is not compatible with the executor the flow will run on the caller's thread and the flow must return an appropriate Future. Finally, you can disable the gateway async handling by setting this attribute to "". This allows the downstream flow to return a Future that would otherwise have been compatible with the default executor.

attributes.name: default-reply-timeout
attributes.description: Allows you to specify how long this gateway will wait for the reply message before returning. By default it will wait indefinitely. 'null' is returned if the gateway times out. Value is specified in milliseconds; it can be a simple long value or a SpEL expression; array variable #args is available. Also used for receive-only operations as the receive timeout.

attributes.name: service-interface
attributes.description: The name of the interface which will be exposed by this gateway.

attributes.name: mapper
attributes.description: An MethodArgsMessageMapper to map the method arguments to a Message. When this is provided, no payload-expressions or headers are allowed; the custom mapper is responsible for creating the message.

attributes.name: default-reply-channel
attributes.description: Identifies default channel this gateway will subscribe to to receive reply Messages, which will then be converted to the return type of the method signature.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies a channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this gateway's invocation. If no "error-channel" reference is provided, this gateway will propagate Exceptions to the caller. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: default-request-channel
attributes.description: Identifies default channel the messages will be sent to upon invocation of methods of this gateway

children.name: default-header
children.description: Provides a mechanism to enrich the message with custom message headers. These default headers are created for all methods on the service-interface (unless overridden by a specific method element).

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the header

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to produce a value for the header. Either this or 'value' must be provided.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the header. Either this or 'expression' must be provided.

children.name: method
children.description: Provides mechanism to define method per channel mappings for this gateway

attributes.name: payload-expression
attributes.description: Expression that should be evaluated to generate the payload.

attributes.name: request-timeout
attributes.description: Provides the amount of time dispatcher would wait to send a message. This timeout would only apply if there is a potential to block in the send call. For example if this gateway is hooked up to a Queue channel. Value is specified in milliseconds.

attributes.name: reply-timeout
attributes.description: Allows you to specify how long this gateway will wait for the reply message before returning. By default it will wait indefinitely. 'null' is returned if the gateway times out. Value is specified in milliseconds.

attributes.name: reply-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the channel to which this gateway will subscribe, to receive reply Messages. The reply Message will then be converted to the return type of the method signature.

attributes.name: request-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel the message will be sent to upon invocation of this method

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the method

children.name: header
children.description: Provides a mechanism to enrich the message with custom message headers. When this method is invoked, the generated message will be enriched with these headers.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the header

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to produce a value for the header. Either this or 'value' must be provided.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the header. Either this or 'expression' must be provided.

integration.name: idempotent-receiver
integration.description: Defines an 'org.springframework.integration.handler.advice.IdempotentReceiverInterceptor' bean.

attributes.name: key-expression
attributes.description: Expression to populate an 'ExpressionEvaluatingMessageProcessor'. Used by the underlying 'org.springframework.integration.selector.MetadataStoreSelector'. Evaluates an 'idempotentKey' using the request Message as the evaluation context root object. Mutually exclusive with 'selector' and 'key-strategy'.

attributes.name: value-expression
attributes.description: Expression to populate an 'ExpressionEvaluatingMessageProcessor'. Used by the underlying 'org.springframework.integration.selector.MetadataStoreSelector'. Evaluates a 'value' for the 'idempotentKey' using the request Message as the evaluation context root object. Mutually exclusive with 'selector' and 'value-strategy'. By default, the 'MetadataStoreSelector' uses the 'timestamp' message header as the Metadata 'value'.

attributes.name: discard-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the channel to send a message when 'IdempotentReceiverInterceptor' doesn't accept the message. When omitted, duplicate messages are forwarded to the handler with a 'DUPLICATE_MESSAGE' header.

attributes.name: value-strategy
attributes.description: A 'MessageProcessor' reference. Used by the underlying 'org.springframework.integration.selector.MetadataStoreSelector'. Evaluates a 'value' for the 'idempotentKey' from the request Message. Mutually exclusive with 'selector' and 'value-expression'. By default, the 'MetadataStoreSelector' uses the 'timestamp' message header as the Metadata 'value'.

attributes.name: key-strategy
attributes.description: A 'MessageProcessor' reference. Used by the underlying 'org.springframework.integration.selector.MetadataStoreSelector'. Evaluates an 'idempotentKey' from the request Message. Mutually exclusive with 'selector' and 'key-expression'.

attributes.name: selector
attributes.description: A 'MessageSelector' reference. Used to identify if the message should be accepted by the target 'MessageHandler' endpoint. Mutually exclusive with 'metadata-store' and 'key-strategy' or 'key-expression'.

attributes.name: endpoint
attributes.description: Consumer Endpoint name(s) or patterns. To specify more than one name(pattern) use ',' (e.g. endpoint="xxx, xxx*, *xxx, *xxx*, xxx*yyy"). The endpoint 'id' is used to retrieve the target endpoint's 'MessageHandler' bean (using its '.handler' suffix), for which the 'IdempotentReceiverInterceptor' will be applied.

attributes.name: metadata-store
attributes.description: A 'ConcurrentMetadataStore' reference. Used by the underlying 'org.springframework.integration.selector.MetadataStoreSelector'. Mutually exclusive with 'selector'. Optional. The default 'MetadataStoreSelector' uses an internal 'SimpleMetadataStore' which does not maintain state across application executions.

attributes.name: throw-exception-on-rejection
attributes.description: Throw an exception if the 'IdempotentReceiverInterceptor' rejects the message (default false). It is applied regardless of whether or not a discard channel is provided.

integration.name: spel-function
integration.description: Defines a bean for the 'org.springframework.integration.config.SpelFunctionFactoryBean'.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: The fully qualified class name where to find the static method for SpEL function.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Specifies the name of the SpEL function.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: The method signature in the form 'methodName[([arg_list])]', where 'arg_list' is an optional, comma-separated list of fully-qualified type names.

integration.name: aggregator
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.config.AggregatorFactoryBean'.

attributes.name: correlation-strategy
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the decision algorithm as to whether a given message group is complete. The bean can be an implementation of the CorrelationStrategy interface or a POJO.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by 'ref' attribute

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: lock-registry
attributes.description: A reference to a 'org.springframework.integration.support.locks.LockRegistry' bean to obtain 'java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock' by 'groupId'. Used for concurrent operations on MessageGroups. By default an internal 'DefaultLockRegistry' is used.

attributes.name: message-store
attributes.description: Reference to a MessageGroupStore for holding state in between message processing. The default is to use a volatile in-memory store, which means that unprocessed messages will be lost if the JVM exits. To customize the expiry of incomplete message groups configure the message store.

attributes.name: release-strategy-method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by release-strategy, that implements the completion decision algorithm.

attributes.name: release-lock-before-send
attributes.description: Set to true to release the message group lock before sending any output. See "Avoiding Deadlocks" in the Aggregator section of the reference manual for more information as to why this might be needed.

attributes.name: headers-function
attributes.description: A reference to the 'Function' for merging and computing message headers for reply based on the 'MessageGroup' to release.

attributes.name: send-partial-result-on-expiry
attributes.description: Specifies whether messages that expired should be aggregated and sent to the 'output-channel' or 'replyChannel'. Messages are expired when their containing MessageGroup expires. One of the ways of expiring MessageGroups is by configuring a MessageGroupStoreReaper. However MessageGroups can alternatively be expired by simply calling MessageGroupStore.expireMessageGroups(timeout). That could be accomplished via a ControlBus operation or by simply invoking that method if you have a reference to the MessageGroupStore instance.

attributes.name: expire-groups-upon-completion
attributes.description: Boolean flag specifying if MessageGroup should be removed once completed. Useful for handling late arrival use cases where messages arriving with the correlationKey that is the same as the completed MessageGroup will be discarded. Default is 'false'

attributes.name: discard-channel
attributes.description: The channel where the aggregator will send the messages that timed out (if send-partial-results- on-expiry is 'false').

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: release-strategy
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the release strategy. The bean can be an implementation of the ReleaseStrategy interface or a POJO

attributes.name: release-strategy-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to evaluate against a root object that is the Collection of messages within the message group (e.g, size() > 6)

attributes.name: empty-group-min-timeout
attributes.description: Empty groups exist after a group is released normally. This is to enable the detection and discarding of late-arriving messages. If you wish to run empty group deletion on a longer schedule than expiring partial groups, set this property. Empty groups will then not be removed from the MessageStore until they have not been modified for at least this number of milliseconds. If this is set, the group is scheduled for removal after normal or partial sequences group release. When a MessageGroupStoreReaper is configured to expire partial groups, empty groups are also removed, but using this value. Note that the actual time to expire an empty group will also be affected by the reaper's 'timeout' property and it could be as much as this value plus the timeout.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: pop-sequence
attributes.description: Boolean flag specifying, if the 'MessageBuilder.popSequenceDetails()' should be called for the output message. Plays the opposite role to the 'AbstractMessageSplitter.setApplySequence()'. Defaults to 'true'.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: 'id' value: - Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (AbstractEndpoint) - as MessageHandler bean alias together with suffix '.handler'

attributes.name: correlation-strategy-method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by correlation-strategy, that implements the correlation decision algorithm

attributes.name: expire-groups-upon-timeout
attributes.description: Boolean flag specifying, if a group is completed due to timeout (reaper or 'group-timeout(-expression)'), whether the group should be removed. When true, late arriving messages will form a new group. When false, they will be discarded. Default is 'true' for an aggregator and 'false' for a resequencer.

attributes.name: group-timeout-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to evaluate a 'group-timeout' with the MessageGroup as the #root evaluation context object for scheduling the MessageGroup forced completion, when the 'ReleaseStrategy' does not 'release' the group when the current Message arrives. If 'group-timeout-expression' evaluates to 'null' or less than '0', the MessageGroup won't be scheduled to be forced complete. The action taken when the group is forced complete depends on the 'send-partial-result-on-expiry' attribute. Mutually exclusive with the 'group-timeout' attribute.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the handler. The bean can be an implementation of the MessageHandler interface or a POJO

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.name: group-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout in milliseconds to force the MessageGroup complete, when the 'ReleaseStrategy' does not 'release' the group when the current Message arrives. If 'group-timeout' is not provided or is less than '0' the MessageGroup won't be scheduled to be forced complete. The action taken when the group is forced complete depends on the 'send-partial-result-on-expiry' attribute. Mutually exclusive with the 'group-timeout-expression' attribute.

attributes.name: correlation-strategy-expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression which implements correlation decision algorithm to apply to the Message (e.g., payload.getPerson().getId() - correlate based on the 'id' of the 'person' attribute of the message payload object)

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: scheduler
attributes.description: Provide a reference to the TaskScheduler instance to schedule 'forceComplete' on the MessageGroup when no new message arrives for the MessageGroup within the 'group-timeout' or 'group-timeout-expression'. If it isn't provided, the default scheduler 'taskScheduler', registered in the ApplicationContext {ThreadPoolTaskScheduler} will be used. This attribute only applies if 'group-timeout' or 'group-timeout-expression' is specified.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to be evaluated against the input message list as its root object.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines the configuration metadata for a poller.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory

attributes.name: isolation

Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

attributes.name: transaction-manager

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation

attributes.name: synchronization-factory

Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

integration.name: outbound-channel-adapter
integration.description: Defines an endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.handler.ExpressionEvaluatingMessageHandler' or 'org.springframework.integration.handler.MethodInvokingMessageHandler'.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. Depending on the type of the adapter this channel could be the receiving channel (e.g., outbound-channel-adapter) or channel where messages will be sent to by this adapter (e.g., inbound-channel-adapter).

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by 'ref' attribute

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: A reference to a bean defined in the application context.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression to be evaluated for each triggered execution. The result of the evaluation will be passed as the payload of the Message that is sent to the MessageChannel.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines the configuration metadata for a poller.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. attributes.name: fixed-delay

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref

children.name: advice-chain

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

integration.name: splitter
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.splitter.AbstractMessageProcessingSplitter' implementation or 'org.springframework.integration.splitter.DefaultMessageSplitter'.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: A method defined on the bean referenced by 'ref' attribute

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: If set to 'true', a reply must return a non-null value. By setting 'requires-reply' to 'true', a 'ReplyRequiredException' will be raised for null reply messages. If 'requires-reply' is set to false, those messages are silently dropped. This attribute defaults to 'true' for 'transformer'.

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the handler. The bean can be an implementation of the MessageHandler interface or a POJO

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.name: delimiters
attributes.description: Provide one or more delimiters (as a single String value, e.g. delimiters=",;:") for tokenizing String-typed payload values. This attribute is only allowed if no 'ref' or 'expression' have been provided since that is when the DefaultMessageSplitter would be used, and it's the implementation that contains the "delimiters" property.

attributes.name: apply-sequence
attributes.description: Set this flag to false to prevent adding sequence related headers in this splitter. This can be convenient in cases where the set sequence numbers conflict with downstream custom aggregations. When true, existing correlation and sequence related headers are pushed onto a stack; downstream components, such as aggregators may pop the stack to revert the existing headers after aggregation. Default is 'true'.

attributes.name: discard-channel
attributes.description: The channel where the splitter will send the messages that return an empty container from split function.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: A SpEL expression to be evaluated against the input Message as its root object.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: 'id' value: - Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (AbstractEndpoint) - as MessageHandler bean alias together with suffix '.handler'

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines the configuration metadata for a poller.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

integration.name: message-history
integration.description: Will register a Message History writer which will track the message history. There can only be one Message History writer per ApplicationContext hierarchy. See also @EnableMessageHistory annotation.

attributes.name: tracked-components
attributes.description: The list of component name patterns you want to track (e.g., tracked-components="inputChannel, out*, *Channel, *Service")

integration.name: payload-type-router
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.router.PayloadTypeRouter'. The 'mapping' sub-elements specify the associations between Java types and target channels.

attributes.description: Specify whether sequence number and size headers should be added to each Message. Defaults to false.

attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: ignore-send-failures
attributes.description: If set to "true", failures to send to a message channel will be ignored. If set to "false", a MessageDeliveryException will be thrown instead, and if the router resolves more than one channel, any subsequent channels will not receive the message. Please be aware that when using direct channels (single threaded), send-failures can be caused by exceptions thrown by components much further down-stream. This attribute defaults to false.

attributes.name: default-output-channel
attributes.description: Reference to the channel where Messages should be sent if channel resolution fails to return any channels. If no default output channel is provided, the router will throw an Exception. If you would like to silently drop those messages instead, add the "nullChannel" as the default output channel attribute value.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: resolution-required
attributes.description: Specify whether channel names must always be successfully resolved to existing channel instances. If set to 'true', a MessagingException will be raised in case the channel cannot be resolved. Setting this attribute to 'false', will cause any unresolvable channels to be ignored. If not explicitly set, 'resolution-required' will default to 'true'.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending Messages to the target MessageChannels if blocking is possible (e.g. a bounded queue channel that is currently full). By default the send will block indefinitely. Synonym for 'timeout' - only one can be supplied.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition which in case of Routers is an instance of EventDrivenConsumer or PollingConsumer depending on whether the Router's "input-channel" is a "SubscribableChannel" or "PollableChannel", respectively. This is an "optional" attribute.

attributes.description: Reference to a Deserializer instance to convert from a byte array to an object. This is optional. The default will use standard Java deserialization.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: white-list
attributes.description: When using the default Deserializer, a list of package/class patterns indicating classes that are allowed to be deserialized. Consider providing this if you receive data from untrusted sources. Example: "com.mycom.*, com.yourcom.*".

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.description: Boolean flag that specifies whether values provided in 'header-names' should be treated as match patterns or literal values. For example header-names='foo*' would mean remove all headers that begin with 'foo' including the header named 'foo*'. However if you want to treat '*' as literal value setting this flag to FALSE will not perform pattern match and the only header that will be removed is the one that is an exact match.

This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: If set to 'true', a reply must return a non-null value. By setting 'requires-reply' to 'true', a 'ReplyRequiredException' will be raised for null reply messages. If 'requires-reply' is set to false, those messages are silently dropped. This attribute defaults to 'true' for 'transformer'.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: 'id' value: - Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition (AbstractEndpoint) - as MessageHandler bean alias together with suffix '.handler'

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: A reference to a bean that implements the handler. The bean can be an implementation of the MessageHandler interface or a POJO

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines the configuration metadata for a poller.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: The reference to an ExpressionSource.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description: The key for retrieving the expression from an ExpressionSource.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

integration.name: annotation-config
integration.description: Enables annotation support for Message Endpoints.

attributes.name: proxy-target-class
attributes.description: Indicate whether subclass-based (CGLIB) proxies are to be created as opposed to standard Java interface-based proxies.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Indicate the order in which the 'org.springframework.integration.aop.PublisherAnnotationBeanPostProcessor' should be applied. Defaults to 'org.springframework.core.Ordered.LOWEST_PRECEDENCE'.

attributes.name: default-publisher-channel
attributes.description: Default output channel for the @Publisher annotation support.

integration.name: enricher
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.transformer.ContentEnricher' that passes a Message to its request-channel and then expects a reply Message. The reply Message then becomes the root object for evaluation of expressions to enrich the target payload.

attributes.name: request-channel
attributes.description: Channel to which a Message will be sent to get the data to use for enrichment. This attribute is optional. Not specifying a 'request-channel' is useful in situations, where only static values shall be used for enrichment using the 'property' sub-element.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: reply-timeout
attributes.description: Set the timeout value for receiving reply messages in milliseconds. If not explicitly configured, the default is one second.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Used when exceptions occur in a downstream flow and allows the error handling flow to return an alternative object to use for enrichment. If no "error-channel" reference is provided, this enricher will propagate Exceptions to the caller.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specify the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a reply Message to the output channel. Defaults to '-1' - blocking indefinitely. It is applied only if the output channel has some 'sending' limitations, e.g. QueueChannel with fixed a 'capacity'. In this case a MessageDeliveryException is thrown. The 'send-timeout' is ignored in case of AbstractSubscribableChannel implementations.

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: If you specify a 'request-channel' you can optionally set the 'requires-reply' attribute as well. If you set this attribute to 'true', a reply must return a non-null value. For example, you dispatch a message to the request-channel (backed by a 'QueueChannel'). If the reply does not return within the specified 'replyTimeout', then the reply message will end up being Null. By setting 'requires-reply' to 'true', a 'ReplyRequiredException' will be raised for null reply messages. If 'requires-reply' is set to false, those messages are silently dropped. This attribute defaults to 'true', if not specified.

attributes.name: should-clone-payload
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether any payload that implements Cloneable should be cloned prior to sending the Message to the request channel for acquiring the enriching data. The cloned version would be used as the target payload for the ultimate reply. If the payload does NOT implement 'Cloneable', then setting this attribute to 'true' has NO effect. Default is false.

attributes.name: request-timeout
attributes.description: Set the timeout value for sending request messages in milliseconds. If not explicitly configured, the default is one second.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint

attributes.name: request-payload-expression
attributes.description: By default the original message's payload will be used as payload that will be send to the request-channel. By specifying a SpEL expression as value for the 'request-payload-expression' attribute, a subset of the original payload, a header value or any other resolvable SpEL expression can be used as the basis for the payload, that will be sent to the request-channel. For the Expression evaluation the full message is available as the 'root object'. For instance the following SpEL expressions (among others) are possible: - payload.foo - headers.foobar - new java.util.Date() - 'foo' + 'bar' If more sophisticated logic is required (e.g. changing the message headers etc.) please use additional downstream transformers.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: input-channel
attributes.description: The receiving Message channel of this endpoint

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: reply-channel
attributes.description: Channel where a reply Message is expected. This is optional; typically the auto-generated temporary reply channel is sufficient.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines the configuration metadata for a poller.

attributes.name: time-unit

If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: property
children.description: Each property sub-element provides the name of a property (via the required 'name' attribute). That property should be settable on the target payload instance. Exactly one of the 'value' or 'expression' attributes must be provided as well. The former for a literal value to set, and the latter for a SpEL expression to be evaluated. The root object of the evaluation context is the Message that was returned from the flow initiated by this enricher.

attributes.name: null-result-expression
attributes.description: The expression to be evaluated, when the underlying enricher sub-flow returns null. The evaluation context root object is requestMessage.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the property. Either this or 'expression' must be provided.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to produce a value for the property. Either this or 'value' must be provided.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the property on the target payload. Please be aware that this value is a SpEL expression, also. For example, if your payload is represented by a 'java.util.Map', you can add new Map entries using the 'name' attribute, e.g. name='foo' would add a new Map entry with key 'foo'.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The fully qualified class name of the header value's expected type. Allowed only in case of 'value' attribute.

children.name: header
children.description: Each header sub-element provides the name of a message header (via the required 'name' attribute). Exactly one of the 'value' or 'expression' attributes must be provided as well. The former for a literal value to set, and the latter for a SpEL expression to be evaluated. The root object of the evaluation context is the Message that was returned from the flow initiated by this enricher.

attributes.name: null-result-expression
attributes.description: The expression to be evaluated, when the underlying enricher sub-flow returns null. The evaluation context root object is requestMessage.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the property. Either this or 'expression' must be provided.

attributes.name: overwrite
attributes.description: Boolean value to indicate whether this header value should overwrite an existing header value. Unlike the Header Enricher, this attribute is 'true' by default, similar to the 'property' attribute.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: Expression to be evaluated to produce a value for the property. Either this or 'value' must be provided.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the property on the target payload. Please be aware that this value is a SpEL expression, also. For example, if your payload is represented by a 'java.util.Map', you can add new Map entries using the 'name' attribute, e.g. name='foo' would add a new Map entry with key 'foo'.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The fully qualified class name of the header value's expected type. Allowed only in case of 'value' attribute.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: synchronization-factory

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: retry-advice

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

integration.name: channel-interceptor
integration.description: Allows you to define channel interceptors ('org.springframework.messaging.support.ChannelInterceptor' implementation) to be applied globally.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: [REQUIRED] Channel name(s) or patterns. To specify more than one channel use ','. A leading '!' negates the pattern match ('!foo*' means don't add interceptor where the name matches the pattern 'foo*'). For example "input*, foo, bar, !Foo*".

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: [OPTIONAL] points to a bean reference which implements this interceptor. Could also be defined as inner <bean> element.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: [OPTIONAL] Specifies the order in which this interceptor will be added to the existing channel interceptors (if any). Negative value (e.g., -2) will signify BEFORE existing interceptors (if any). Positive value (e.g., 2) will signify AFTER existing interceptors (if any)

integration.name: syslog-to-map-transformer
integration.description: Defines a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.transformer.SyslogToMapTransformer' that converts an RFC5424 packet to a Map.

attributes.name: output-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the Message channel where Message will be sent after it's being processed by this endpoint
