attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

jms.name: message-driven-channel-adapter
jms.description: Defines a Message Producing Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.jms.JmsMessageDrivenEndpoint' (one-way) to listen form message on the JMS destination.

attributes.name: destination
attributes.description: A reference to a javax.jms.Destination by bean name. As an alternative to a bean reference, use 'destination-name' and 'pub-sub-domain' which will rely upon the DestinationResolver strategy (DynamicDestinationResolver by default).

attributes.name: concurrent-consumers
attributes.description: Specify the number of concurrent consumers to create. Default is 1. Specifying a higher value for this setting will increase the standard level of scheduled concurrent consumers at runtime: This is effectively the minimum number of concurrent consumers which will be scheduled at any given time. This is a static setting; for dynamic scaling, consider specifying the "maxConcurrentConsumers" setting instead. Raising the number of concurrent consumers is recommendable in order to scale the consumption of messages coming in from a queue. However, note that any ordering guarantees are lost once multiple consumers are registered

attributes.name: recovery-interval
attributes.description: Interval in milliseconds between the recovery attempts

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: acknowledge
attributes.description: The native JMS acknowledge mode: "auto", "client", "dups-ok" or "transacted". The latter effectively activates a locally transacted Session. 'transacted' is not allowed on the inbound-channel-adapter; use 'session-transacted' instead. acknowlege="transacted" is used on the message-driven-channel-adapter and inbound gateway. Defaults to "transacted" when an implicit message listener container is configured. Not allowed when using an externally configured listener container; configure the container instead.

attributes.name: client-id
attributes.description: The JMS client id for a shared Connection created and used by this container. Note that client ids need to be unique among all active Connections of the underlying JMS provider. Furthermore, a client id can only be assigned if the original ConnectionFactory hasn't already assigned one.

attributes.name: task-executor
attributes.description: A reference to a Spring TaskExecutor (or standard JDK 1.5+ Executor) for running the listener threads. Default for the message listener container is a SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor.

attributes.name: subscription-durable
attributes.description: Boolean property indicating whether to make the subscription durable. The durable subscription name to be used can be specified through the "durableSubscriptionName" property. Default is "false". Set this to "true" to register a durable subscription, typically in combination with a "durableSubscriptionName" value (unless your message listener class name is good enough as subscription name). Only makes sense when listening to a topic (pub-sub domain).

attributes.name: max-concurrent-consumers
attributes.description: Specify the maximum number of concurrent consumers to create. Default is 1. If this setting is higher than "concurrentConsumers", the listener container will dynamically schedule new consumers at runtime, provided that enough incoming messages are encountered. Once the load goes down again, the number of consumers will be reduced to the standard level ("concurrentConsumers") again. Raising the number of concurrent consumers is recommendable in order to scale the consumption of messages coming in from a queue. However, note that any ordering guarantees are lost once multiple consumers are registered.

attributes.name: pub-sub-domain
attributes.description: The boolean property used to configure the listener container with knowledge of what JMS domain is being used. Unless 'subscription-shared' or 'subscription-durable' is true, by default the value of this property is 'false' , indicating that the point-to-point domain, Queues, will be used. When true, the pub/sub domain, Topics, will be used.

attributes.name: subscription-shared
attributes.description: Boolean property indicating whether to make the subscription shared. The shared subscription name to be used can be specified through the 'subscription-name' attribute. Default is "false". Set this to "true" to register a shared subscription, typically in combination with a 'subscription-name' value (unless your message listener class name is good enough as subscription name). Note that shared subscriptions may also be durable, so this flag can (and often will) be combined with 'subscription-durable' as well. Only makes sense when listening to a topic (pub-sub domain), therefore this automatically sets 'pub-sub-domain' to 'true'. Requires a JMS 2.0 compatible message broker.

attributes.name: idle-task-execution-limit
attributes.description: Specify the limit for idle executions of a consumer task, not having received any message within its execution. If this limit is reached, the task will shut down and leave receiving to other executing tasks. The default is 1, closing idle resources early once a task didn't receive a message.

attributes.name: container-class
attributes.description: A custom listener container implementation class as fully qualified class name. Default is Spring's standard DefaultMessageListenerContainer. Note that a custom container class will typically be a subclass of this standard container class. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'container'.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: container
attributes.description: A reference to a custom listener container implementation. Note that a custom container class will typically be a subclass of DefaultMessageListenerContainer. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'container-class'.

attributes.name: subscription-name
attributes.description: The name of a subscription to create. To be applied in case of a topic (pub-sub domain) with a shared or durable subscription. The subscription name needs to be unique within this client's JMS client id. Default is the class name of the specified message listener. Note: Only 1 concurrent consumer (which is the default of the message listener container) is allowed for each subscription, except for a shared subscription (which requires JMS 2.0).

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: If a (synchronous) downstream exception is thrown and an error-channel is specified, the MessagingException will be sent to this channel. Otherwise, any such exception will be propagated to the listener container and any JMS transaction will be rolled back. Any synchronous downstream exceptions in the error flow will also cause any JMS transaction to be rolled back.

attributes.name: max-messages-per-task
attributes.description: Specify the maximum number of messages to process in one task. More concretely, this limits the number of message reception attempts per task, which includes receive iterations that did not actually pick up a message until they hit their timeout

attributes.name: message-converter
attributes.description: A reference to the MessageConverter strategy for converting between JMS Messages and the Spring Integration Message payloads. Default is a SimpleMessageConverter.

attributes.name: idle-consumer-limit
attributes.description: Specify the limit for the number of consumers that are allowed to be idle at any given time. This limit is used to determine if a new invoker should be created. Increasing the limit causes invokers to be created more aggressively. This can be useful to ramp up the number of invokers faster. The default is 1, only scheduling a new invoker (which is likely to be idle initially) if none of the existing invokers is currently idle.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: cache-level
attributes.description: Specify the level of caching that this listener container is allowed to apply: CACHE_NONE = 0 CACHE_CONNECTION = 1 CACHE_SESSION = 2 CACHE_CONSUMER = 3

attributes.name: selector
attributes.description: A JMS Message Selector expression.

jms.name: channel
jms.description: Defines a Message Channel ('org.springframework.integration.jms.config.JmsChannelFactoryBean') that is backed by a JMS Queue.

attributes.name: queue-name
attributes.description: Name of a JMS Queue to be resolved by this channel's DestinationResolver.

attributes.name: task-executor
attributes.description: A reference to a Spring TaskExecutor (or standard JDK 1.5+ Executor) for executing JMS listener invokers. Default is a SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor in case of a DefaultMessageListenerContainer, using internally managed threads. For a SimpleMessageListenerContainer, listeners will always get invoked within the JMS provider's receive thread by default.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: ID for this channel. Required.

attributes.name: prefetch
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages to load into a single session. Note that raising this number might lead to starvation of concurrent consumers!

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: concurrency
attributes.description: The number of concurrent sessions/consumers to start for each listener. Can either be a simple number indicating the maximum number (e.g. "5") or a range indicating the lower as well as the upper limit (e.g. "3-5"). Note that a specified minimum is just a hint and might be ignored at runtime. Default is 1; keep concurrency limited to 1 in case of a topic listener or if message ordering is important; consider raising it for general queues.

attributes.name: time-to-live
attributes.description: Specify the message time to live. This setting will only take effect if 'explicit-qos-enabled' is true.

attributes.name: delivery-persistent
attributes.description: Specify a boolean value indicating whether the delivery mode should be DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT (true) or DeliveryMode.NON_PERSISTENT (false). This setting will only take effect if 'explicit-qos-enabled' is true.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: destination-resolver
attributes.description: A reference to the DestinationResolver strategy for resolving destination names. Default is a DynamicDestinationResolver, using the JMS provider's queue/topic name resolution. Alternatively, specify a reference to a JndiDestinationResolver (typically in a J2EE environment).

attributes.name: message-driven
attributes.description: Specifies whether this channel should be Message-Driven. The value is "true" by default. Set to "false" if this channel should be pollable.

attributes.name: explicit-qos-enabled
attributes.description: Setting this attribute to true enables the use of quality of service attributes - message priority, delivery mode, time to live.

attributes.name: connection-factory
attributes.description: Reference to a JMS ConnectionFactory. If none is provided, the default bean name for the reference will be "jmsConnectionFactory".

attributes.name: acknowledge
attributes.description: The native JMS acknowledge mode: "auto", "client", "dups-ok" or "transacted". A value of "transacted" effectively activates a locally transacted Session; alternatively, specify an external "transaction-manager" via the corresponding attribute. Default is "transacted".

attributes.name: message-converter
attributes.description: A reference to the MessageConverter strategy for converting between JMS Messages and the Spring Integration Message payloads. Default is a SimpleMessageConverter.

attributes.name: container-type
attributes.description: The type of this listener container: "default" or "simple", choosing between DefaultMessageListenerContainer and SimpleMessageListenerContainer.

attributes.name: cache
attributes.description: The cache level for JMS resources: "none", "connection", "session", "consumer" or "auto". By default ("auto"), the cache level will effectively be "consumer", unless an external transaction manager has been specified - in which case the effective default will be "none" (assuming J2EE-style transaction management where the given ConnectionFactory is an XA-aware pool).

attributes.name: priority
attributes.description: Specify the default priority of the message. Overridden by the message priority header, if present; range 0-9. This setting will only take effect if 'explicit-qos-enabled' is true.

attributes.name: max-subscribers
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum subscribers allowed on this channel; defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE, unless a 'channelInitializer' bean has previously been declared, with a different default.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Timeout for the container's consumers if message-driven is TRUE, or timeout for receive calls on the template if message-driven is FALSE.

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: A reference to an external PlatformTransactionManager (typically an XA-based transaction coordinator, e.g. Spring's JtaTransactionManager). If not specified, native acknowledging will be used (see "acknowledge" attribute).

attributes.name: error-handler
attributes.description: A reference to an ErrorHandler strategy for handling any uncaught Exceptions that may occur during the execution of the underlying MessageListener.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: container-class
attributes.description: A custom listener container implementation class as fully qualified class name. Default is Spring's standard DefaultMessageListenerContainer or SimpleMessageListenerContainer, according to the "container-type" attribute. Note that a custom container class will typically be a subclass of either of those two Spring-provided standard container classes: Make sure that the "container-type" attribute matches the actual base type that the custom class derives from ("default" will usually be fine anyway, since most custom classes will derive from DefaultMessageListenerContainer).

attributes.name: selector
attributes.description: The JMS message selector for this channel's underlying MessageListener.

attributes.name: queue
attributes.description: Reference to a JMS Queue. Either this attribute or the 'queue-name' must be provided, but only one.

children.name: interceptors
children.description: A list of ChannelInterceptor instances to be applied to this channel.

children.name: ref
children.description: Reference to a bean in this Application Context that implements ChannelInterceptor

attributes.name: bean
attributes.description: Reference to a bean in this Application Context that implements ChannelInterceptor

children.name: wire-tap
children.description: Allows you to configure a Wire Tap interceptor that will send a copy of the message to a channel identified by 'channel' attribute.

attributes.name: selector
attributes.description: A reference to a bean in the Application Context which implements MessageSelector that must accept a message for it to be sent to the intercepting channel. Mutually exclusive with 'selector-expression'.

attributes.name: selector-expression
attributes.description: A boolean expression evaluated against the message to determine whether it should sent to the intercepting channel. Mutually exclusive with 'selector'.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The timeout for sending the message to the intercepting channel

jms.name: inbound-gateway
jms.description: Defines a Messaging Gateway Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.jms.JmsMessageDrivenEndpoint' to listen for messages in the JMS destination and produce replies.

attributes.name: concurrent-consumers
attributes.description: Specify the number of concurrent consumers to create. Default is 1. Specifying a higher value for this setting will increase the standard level of scheduled concurrent consumers at runtime: This is effectively the minimum number of concurrent consumers which will be scheduled at any given time. This is a static setting; for dynamic scaling, consider specifying the "maxConcurrentConsumers" setting instead. Raising the number of concurrent consumers is recommendable in order to scale the consumption of messages coming in from a queue. However, note that any ordering guarantees are lost once multiple consumers are registered

attributes.name: recovery-interval
attributes.description: Interval in milliseconds between the recovery attempts

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: If a (synchronous) downstream exception is thrown and an "error-channel" is specified, the MessagingException will be sent to this channel; any response from which will be returned as a reply by the gateway. If an "error-channel" is not supplied, any such exception will be propagated to the listener container and any JMS transaction will be rolled back. Any synchronous downstream exceptions in the error flow will also cause any JMS transaction to be rolled back.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: acknowledge
attributes.description: The native JMS acknowledge mode: "auto", "client", "dups-ok" or "transacted". The latter effectively activates a locally transacted Session. 'transacted' is not allowed on the inbound-channel-adapter; use 'session-transacted' instead. acknowlege="transacted" is used on the message-driven-channel-adapter and inbound gateway. Defaults to "transacted" when an implicit message listener container is configured. Not allowed when using an externally configured listener container; configure the container instead.

attributes.name: request-destination
attributes.description: A reference to a javax.jms.Destination by bean name. As an alternative to a bean reference, use 'request-destination-name' and 'request-pub-sub-domain' which will rely upon the DestinationResolver strategy (DynamicDestinationResolver by default).

attributes.name: client-id
attributes.description: The JMS client id for a shared Connection created and used by this container. Note that client ids need to be unique among all active Connections of the underlying JMS provider. Furthermore, a client id can only be assigned if the original ConnectionFactory hasn't already assigned one.

attributes.name: subscription-durable
attributes.description: Boolean property indicating whether to make the subscription durable. The durable subscription name to be used can be specified through the "durableSubscriptionName" property. Default is "false". Set this to "true" to register a durable subscription, typically in combination with a "durableSubscriptionName" value (unless your message listener class name is good enough as subscription name). Only makes sense when listening to a topic (pub-sub domain).

attributes.name: max-concurrent-consumers
attributes.description: Specify the maximum number of concurrent consumers to create. Default is 1. If this setting is higher than "concurrentConsumers", the listener container will dynamically schedule new consumers at runtime, provided that enough incoming messages are encountered. Once the load goes down again, the number of consumers will be reduced to the standard level ("concurrentConsumers") again. Raising the number of concurrent consumers is recommendable in order to scale the consumption of messages coming in from a queue. However, note that any ordering guarantees are lost once multiple consumers are registered.

attributes.name: idle-task-execution-limit
attributes.description: Specify the limit for idle executions of a consumer task, not having received any message within its execution. If this limit is reached, the task will shut down and leave receiving to other executing tasks. The default is 1, closing idle resources early once a task didn't receive a message.

attributes.name: container-class
attributes.description: A custom listener container implementation class as fully qualified class name. Default is Spring's standard DefaultMessageListenerContainer. Note that a custom container class will typically be a subclass of this standard container class. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'container'.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: container
attributes.description: A reference to a custom listener container implementation. Note that a custom container class will typically be a subclass of DefaultMessageListenerContainer. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'container-class'.

attributes.name: subscription-name
attributes.description: The name of a subscription to create. To be applied in case of a topic (pub-sub domain) with a shared or durable subscription. The subscription name needs to be unique within this client's JMS client id. Default is the class name of the specified message listener. Note: Only 1 concurrent consumer (which is the default of the message listener container) is allowed for each subscription, except for a shared subscription (which requires JMS 2.0).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-task
attributes.description: Specify the maximum number of messages to process in one task. More concretely, this limits the number of message reception attempts per task, which includes receive iterations that did not actually pick up a message until they hit their timeout

attributes.name: subscription-shared
attributes.description: Boolean property indicating whether to make the subscription shared. The shared subscription name to be used can be specified through the 'subscription-name' attribute. Default is "false". Set this to "true" to register a shared subscription, typically in combination with a 'subscription-name' value (unless your message listener class name is good enough as subscription name). Note that shared subscriptions may also be durable, so this flag can (and often will) be combined with 'subscription-durable' as well. Only makes sense when listening to a topic (pub-sub domain), therefore this automatically sets 'request-pub-sub-domain' to 'true'. Requires a JMS 2.0 compatible message broker.

attributes.name: message-converter
attributes.description: A reference to the MessageConverter strategy for converting between JMS Messages and the Spring Integration Message payloads. Default is a SimpleMessageConverter.

attributes.name: correlation-key
attributes.description: Provide the name of a JMS property that should be copied from the request Message to the reply Message. If NO value is provided for this attribute then the JMSMessageID from the request will be copied into the JMSCorrelationID of the reply unless there is already a value in the JMSCorrelationID property of the newly created reply Message in which case nothing will be copied. If the JMSCorrelationID of the request Message should be copied into the JMSCorrelationID of the reply Message instead, then this value should be set to "JMSCorrelationID". Any other value will be treated as a JMS String Property to be copied as-is from the request Message into the reply Message with the same property name.

attributes.name: default-reply-destination
attributes.description: A reference to a javax.jms.Destination by bean name. As an alternative to a bean reference, use either 'default-reply-queue-name' or 'default-reply-topic-name' which will rely upon the DestinationResolver strategy (DynamicDestinationResolver by default).

attributes.name: idle-consumer-limit
attributes.description: Specify the limit for the number of consumers that are allowed to be idle at any given time. This limit is used to determine if a new invoker should be created. Increasing the limit causes invokers to be created more aggressively. This can be useful to ramp up the number of invokers faster. The default is 1, only scheduling a new invoker (which is likely to be idle initially) if none of the existing invokers is currently idle.

attributes.name: header-mapper
attributes.description: Allows to specify custom implementation of JmsHeaderMapper to map Message Headers to JMS Message.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: cache-level
attributes.description: Specify the level of caching that this listener container is allowed to apply: CACHE_NONE = 0 CACHE_CONNECTION = 1 CACHE_SESSION = 2 CACHE_CONSUMER = 3

attributes.name: selector
attributes.description: A JMS Message Selector expression.

kafka.name: outbound-channel-adapter
kafka.description: Defines the Consumer Endpoint for the KafkaProducerMessageHandler that writes the contents of the Message to kafka broker.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. Depending on the type of the adapter this channel could be the receiving channel (e.g., outbound-channel-adapter) or channel where messages will be sent to by this adapter (e.g., inbound-channel-adapter).

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: message-key
attributes.description: Specifies the Key for the Kafka message. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'message-key-expression' attribute.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Specifies a timeout in milliseconds for how long the 'KafkaProducerMessageHandler' should wait wait for send operation results. Defaults to 10 seconds. The timeout is applied only in 'sync' mode.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a SubscribableChannel.

attributes.name: send-success-channel
attributes.description: Specifies the channel to which message with a payload of type 'org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.RecordMetadata' will be sent after a successful send.

attributes.name: send-timeout-expression
attributes.description: Specifies an expression that is evaluated to determine a timeout in milliseconds for how long the 'KafkaProducerMessageHandler' should wait wait for send operation results. Defaults to 10 seconds. The timeout is applied only in 'sync' mode.

attributes.name: topic-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the expression to determine the name of the Kafka topic against the Message at runtime. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'topic' attribute.

attributes.name: partition-id
attributes.description: Specifies the target partition for the Kafka message. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'partition-id-expression' attribute.

attributes.name: send-failure-channel
attributes.description: Specifies the channel to which an ErrorMessage for a failed send will be sent.

attributes.name: timestamp-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the expression to determine the timestamp for a Kafka record against the Message at runtime.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: error-message-strategy
attributes.description: Specifies the Strategy for building an ErrorMessage.

attributes.name: partition-id-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the expression to determine the partition for Kafka message against the Message at runtime. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'partition-id' attribute.

attributes.name: topic
attributes.description: Specifies the name of the Kafka topic. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'topic-expression' attribute.

attributes.name: sync
attributes.description: Specifies whether to block the sending thread until the producer callback has been invoked, indicating the broker has accepted the message (or an exception thrown if the send fails). Default: false.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: kafka-template
attributes.description: Specifies the KafkaTemplate used to publish messages.

attributes.name: message-key-expression
attributes.description: Specifies the expression to determine the Key for Kafka message against the Message at runtime. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'message-key' attribute.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

kafka.name: message-driven-channel-adapter
kafka.description: Defines the Message Producing Endpoint for the KafkaMessageDrivenChannelAdapter.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when sending a message to the channel if such channel may block. For example, a Queue Channel can block until space is available if its maximum capacity has been reached.

attributes.name: payload-type
attributes.description: Set the payload type to convert to when using a type-aware message converter such as the StringJsonMessageConverter. Fully qualified class name; defaults to 'java.lang.Object'.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. Depending on the type of the adapter this channel could be the receiving channel (e.g., outbound-channel-adapter) or channel where messages will be sent to by this adapter (e.g., inbound-channel-adapter).

attributes.name: message-converter
attributes.description: An 'org.springframework.kafka.support.converter.MessageConverter' bean reference. if mode = 'record' must be a 'RecordMessageConverter'; if mode = 'batch' must be a `BatchMessageConverter`. Defaults to the default implementation for each mode.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: recovery-callback
attributes.description: Used in conjunction with a 'retry-template'; in most cases this will be an 'ErrorMessageSendingRecoverer'. Omitting this element will cause an exception to be thrown to the listener container after retries are exhausted.

attributes.name: listener-container
attributes.description: An 'org.springframework.kafka.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer' bean reference.

attributes.name: retry-template
attributes.description: A retry template for retrying deliveries; an 'error-channel' is not allowed when a retry template is provided; configure a 'recovery-callback' such as an 'ErrorMessageSendingRecoverer' when using a retry template.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: 'record' or 'batch' - default 'record' - one converted ConsumerRecord per message, when 'batch' then the payload is a collection of converted ConsumerRecords.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Message Channel to which error Messages should be sent.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: error-message-strategy
attributes.description: Specifies the Strategy for building an ErrorMessage.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

mqtt.name: message-driven-channel-adapter
mqtt.description: Defines a Message Producing Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.mqtt.inbound.MqttPahoMessageDrivenChannelAdapter' that subscribes to the MQTT topic(s) and produces messages to the channel.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: MQTT broker URL.

attributes.name: topics
attributes.description: Specifies one or more (comma-delimited) topics on which to listen for messages.

attributes.name: client-factory
attributes.description: An MqttClientFactory used to create clients and connection options if you wish to override the defaults. Default is DefaultMqttClientFactory.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: Allows you to specify how long this inbound-channel-adapter will wait for the message to be sent successfully to the message channel, before throwing an exception. This only applies when the channel might block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition, which is an instance of either 'EventDrivenConsumer' or 'PollingConsumer', depending on whether the component's input channel is a 'SubscribableChannel' or 'PollableChannel'.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: Flag to indicate the phase in which the component should start automatically on startup. See SmartLifecycle.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Flag to indicate that the component should start automatically on startup (default true).

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: If a downstream exception is thrown and an error-channel is specified, the MessagingException will be sent to this channel. Otherwise, any such exception will be logged.

attributes.name: converter
attributes.description: A message converter to convert Spring Integration Message<String> to/from a paho MqttMessage. Default is DefaultMqttMessageConverter.

attributes.name: client-id
attributes.description: MQTT client ID.

attributes.name: qos
attributes.description: Specifies the QoS to use when subscribing to topics; default '1'. This can be single value (applying to all topics); otherwise it must be a comma-delimited list corresponding to the provided topics (the name number of elements must be provided).

attributes.name: recovery-interval
attributes.description: The time in milliseconds to wait between reconnection attempts. Defaults to 10 seconds.

mqtt.name: outbound-channel-adapter
mqtt.description: Configures a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.mqtt.outbound.MqttPahoMessageDrivenChannelAdapter' that sends messages to the MQTT topic.

attributes.name: retained-expression
attributes.description: Specifies an expression to evaluate to determine the message 'retained' flag. Default "headers['mqtt_retained']".

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Channel from which messages will be output. When a message is sent to this channel it will cause the query to be executed.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: MQTT broker URL.

attributes.name: default-topic
attributes.description: Specifies the default topic to which messages will be sent. Required if the 'topic-expression' evaluates to 'null'

attributes.name: qos-expression
attributes.description: Specifies an expression to evaluate to determine the message qos. Default "headers['mqtt_qos']".

attributes.name: default-qos
attributes.description: Specifies the default quality of service; used if the 'qos-expression' evaluates to 'null'. Default 0.

attributes.name: client-factory
attributes.description: An MqttClientFactory used to create clients and connection options if you wish to override the defaults. Default is DefaultMqttClientFactory.

attributes.name: async-events
attributes.description: When 'async' is true, specifies that message sent and message delivery events will be published for reception by a suitably configured 'ApplicationListener' or an event inbound-channel-adapter. Default: 'false'.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a SubscribableChannel.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Identifies the underlying Spring bean definition, which is an instance of either 'EventDrivenConsumer' or 'PollingConsumer', depending on whether the component's input channel is a 'SubscribableChannel' or 'PollableChannel'.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: Flag to indicate the phase in which the component should start automatically on startup. See SmartLifecycle.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Flag to indicate that the component should start automatically on startup (default true).

attributes.name: converter
attributes.description: A message converter to convert Spring Integration Message<String> to/from a paho MqttMessage. Default is DefaultMqttMessageConverter.

attributes.name: client-id
attributes.description: MQTT client ID.

attributes.name: default-retained
attributes.description: Specifies the default value of the 'retained' flag; used if the 'retained-expression' evaluates to 'null'. Default false.

attributes.name: topic-expression
attributes.description: Specifies an expression to evaluate to determine the destination topic. Default "headers['mqtt_topic']".

attributes.name: async
attributes.description: Specifies that sends should not block, with the thread returning immediately the message is sent. When 'true', message sent and message delivery events can be published; see 'async-events'. Default: 'false'.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.name: recovery-channel
attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.name: max-attempts
attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).

children.name: fixed-back-off
children.description: Defines a fixed back off policy.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between attempts. Default 1000.

children.name: exponential-back-off
children.description: Defines an exponential back off policy.

attributes.name: maximum
attributes.description: The maximum interval in milliseconds between attempts; caps an interval calculated using the multiplier. Default 30000.

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: The previous interval is multiplied by this to determine the next interval, but also see 'maximum'. Default 2.0.

attributes.name: initial
attributes.description: The interval in milliseconds between the first and second attempts. Default 100.

sftp.name: inbound-channel-adapter
sftp.description: Configures a 'SourcePollingChannelAdapter' Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.sftp.inbound.SftpInboundFileSynchronizingMessageSource' that synchronizes with a remote SFTP endpoint.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: preserve-timestamp
attributes.description: Specify whether to preserve the modified timestamp from the remote source file on the local file after copying. By default, the remote timestamp will NOT be preserved.

attributes.name: channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel attached to this adapter. The channel to which messages will be sent by this adapter.

attributes.name: remote-file-separator
attributes.description: Allows you to provide remote file/directory separator character. DEFAULT: '/'

attributes.name: temporary-file-suffix
attributes.description: Extension used when downloading files. We change it right after we know it's downloaded.

attributes.name: local-filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to a [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter is applied to files after they have been retrieved. The default is an AcceptOnceFileListFilter which means that, even if a new instance of a file is retrieved from the remote server, a message won't be generated. The filter provided here is combined with a filter that prevents the message source from processing files that are currently being downloaded.

attributes.name: metadata-store-prefix
attributes.description: Specify a prefix for metadata store to distinguish keys from another places where the same shared store is used. By default, the remote a component name is used.

attributes.name: max-fetch-size
attributes.description: When fetching objects from some external resource, limit the number of such objects that will be retrieved on each fetch. A negative value (default) indicates no limit; a value of zero effectively disables fetching remote objects.

attributes.name: local-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the directory path (e.g., "/local/mytransfers") where files will be transferred TO.

attributes.name: comparator
attributes.description: Specify a Comparator to be used when ordering Files. If none is provided, the order will be determined by the java.io.File implementation of Comparable.

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: scanner
attributes.description: Reference to a custom DirectoryScanner implementation.

attributes.name: remote-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specify a SpEL expression which will be used to evaluate the directory path to where the files will be transferred (e.g., "headers.['remote_dir'] + '/myTransfers'" for outbound endpoints) There is no root object (message) for inbound endpoints (e.g., "@someBean.fetchDirectory");

attributes.name: local-filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a SpEL expression to generate the file name of the local (transferred) file. The root object of the SpEL evaluation is the name of the original file. For example, a valid expression would be "#this.toUpperCase() + '.a'" where #this represents the original name of the remote file.

attributes.name: auto-create-local-directory
attributes.description: Tells this adapter if the local directory must be auto-created if it doesn't exist. Default is TRUE.

attributes.name: delete-remote-files
attributes.description: Specify whether to delete the remote source file after copying. By default, the remote files will NOT be deleted.

attributes.name: filename-pattern
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a file name pattern to determine the file names that need to be scanned. This is based on simple pattern matching (e.g., "*.txt, fo*.txt" etc.)

attributes.name: remote-file-metadata-store
attributes.description: Reference to a MetadataStore for saving remote files information between synchronization and polling.

attributes.name: filter-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate against file to accept it for processing or not. Mutually exclusive with 'filter' attribute.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to a [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter is applied to files on the remote server and only files that pass the filter are retrieved.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: remote-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the remote directory path (e.g., "/remote/mytransfers") Mutually exclusive with 'remote-directory-expression'.

attributes.name: filename-regex
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a Regular Expression to determine the file names that need to be scanned. (e.g., "f[o]+\.txt" etc.)

attributes.name: session-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an [org.springframework.integration.file.remote.session.SessionFactory] bean with a [com.jcraft.jsch.ChannelSftp$LsEntry] generic type parameter.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

attributes.name: time-unit
attributes.description: The java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit enum value. This can ONLY be used in combination with the 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' attributes. If combined with either 'cron' or a 'trigger' reference attribute, it will cause a failure. The minimal supported granularity for a PeriodicTrigger is MILLISECONDS. Therefore, the only available options are MILLISECONDS and SECONDS. If this value is not provided, then any 'fixed-delay' or 'fixed-rate' value will be interpreted as MILLISECONDS by default. Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

attributes.name: error-channel
attributes.description: Identifies channel that error messages will be sent to if a failure occurs in this poller's invocation. To completely suppress Exceptions, provide a reference to the "nullChannel" here.

attributes.name: fixed-delay
attributes.description: Fixed delay trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: max-messages-per-poll
attributes.description: The maximum number of messages that will be produced for each poll. Defaults to infinity (indicated by -1) for polling consumers, and 1 for polled inbound channel adapters.

attributes.name: fixed-rate
attributes.description: Fixed rate trigger (in milliseconds).

attributes.name: ref
attributes.description: Allows this poller to reference another instance of a top-level poller. [IMPORTANT] - This attribute is only allowed on inner poller definitions. Defining this attribute on a top-level poller definition will result in a configuration exception.

attributes.name: receive-timeout
attributes.description: Only applies to polling consumers - the time the poll thread will wait after the trigger for a new message to arrive. Defaults to 1000 (1 second). For polled inbound channel adapters, whether or not the polling thread blocks is dependent on the message source implementation.

attributes.name: cron
attributes.description: Cron trigger.

children.name: transactional
children.description: Run each poll task in a transaction; mutually exclusive with 'advice-chain'; add a transaction advice if you need transactions in addition to other advices.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The transaction timeout value (in seconds).

attributes.name: propagation
attributes.description: The transaction propagation behavior.

attributes.name: read-only
attributes.description: Is this transaction read-only?

attributes.name: transaction-manager
attributes.description: The bean name of the PlatformTransactionManager to use.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: The transaction isolation level.

children.name: advice-chain
children.description: A chain of nested AOP 'Advice' objects applied to the poller task. Mutually exclusive with 'transactional'.

attributes.name: synchronization-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an instance of org.springframework.integration.transaction.TransactionSynchronizationFactory which will return an instance of org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionSynchronization via its create(..) method. Setting of this attribute will only have an affect if a Transaction advice is present in the chain.

sftp.name: outbound-gateway
sftp.description: Configures a Consumer Endpoint for the 'org.springframework.integration.sftp.gateway.SftpOutboundGateway used to issue SFTP commands.

attributes.name: requires-reply
attributes.description: Specify whether this outbound gateway must return a non-null value. This value is 'true' by default, and a ReplyRequiredException will be thrown when the underlying service returns a null value.

attributes.name: mput-regex
attributes.description: Allows you to provide Regular Expression to determine the file names sent by the 'mput' command (e.g., "f[o]+\.txt" etc.) Only one of 'mput-filter', 'mput-pattern', or 'mput-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: auto-create-directory
attributes.description: Specify whether to automatically create the remote target directory if it doesn't exist.

attributes.name: auto-startup
attributes.description: Boolean value indicating whether this endpoint should start automatically.

attributes.name: mput-filter-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate against file to accept it for processing or not. Mutually exclusive with 'mput-filter' attribute.

attributes.name: mput-filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter acts on the local file system when using the 'mput' command. Only one of 'mput-filter', 'mput-pattern', or 'mput-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: remote-file-separator
attributes.description: Allows you to provide remote file/directory separator character. DEFAULT: '/'

attributes.name: temporary-file-suffix
attributes.description: Extension used when downloading files. We change it right after we know it's downloaded.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: sftp command.

attributes.name: filename-pattern
attributes.description: Allows you to provide file name pattern to determine the file names retrieved by the 'ls' and 'mget' commands and is based on simple pattern matching algorithm (e.g., "*.txt, fo*.txt" etc.) Only one of 'filter', 'filename-pattern', or 'filename-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression representing the path in the command (e.g. ls path to list the files in directory path).

attributes.name: phase
attributes.description: The lifecycle phase within which this endpoint should start and stop. The lower the value the earlier this endpoint will start and the later it will stop. The default is 0. Values can be negative. See SmartLifeCycle.

attributes.name: command-options
attributes.description: sftp command options; for ls, -1 means just return the file names (otherwise file metadata is returned, -dirs means include directories (not included by default), -links means include links (not included by default); for get, -P means preserve timestamp from remote file.

attributes.name: temporary-remote-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the remote temporary directory path (e.g., "/remote/temp/mytransfers")

attributes.name: remote-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specify a SpEL expression which will be used to evaluate the directory path to where the files will be transferred (e.g., "headers.['remote_dir'] + '/myTransfers'" for outbound endpoints) There is no root object (message) for inbound endpoints (e.g., "@someBean.fetchDirectory");

attributes.name: local-filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide a SpEL expression to generate the file name of the local (transferred) file. The root object of the SpEL evaluation is the request Message, but the name of the original remote file is also provided as the 'remoteFileName' variable. For example, a valid expression would be: "#remoteFileName.toUpperCase() + headers.foo". Only used with 'get' and 'mget' commands.

attributes.name: auto-create-local-directory
attributes.description: Tells this adapter if local directory must be auto-created if it doesn''t exist. Default is TRUE.

attributes.name: request-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the request channel attached to this gateway.

attributes.name: mput-pattern
attributes.description: Allows you to provide file name pattern to determine the file names sent by the 'mput' command and is based on simple pattern matching algorithm (e.g., "*.txt, fo*.txt" etc.) Only one of 'mput-filter', 'mput-pattern', or 'mput-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: remote-filename-generator
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to [org.springframework.integration.file.FileNameGenerator] bean.

attributes.name: session-callback
attributes.description: The 'MessageSessionCallback' bean reference to perform custom operation(s) on 'Session' with 'requestMessage'.

attributes.name: local-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specifies SpEL expression to generate the directory path where file will be transferred TO, when using 'get' and 'mget' commands. The root object of the SpEL evaluation is the request Message, but the name of the source remote directory is also provided as the 'remoteDirectory' variable. For example, a valid expression might be: "'/local/' + #remoteDirectory.toUpperCase() + headers.foo". Only used with 'get' and 'mget' commands. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'local-directory'.

attributes.name: reply-timeout
attributes.description: Allows you to specify how long this gateway will wait for the reply message to be sent successfully to the reply channel before throwing an exception. This attribute only applies when the channel might block, for example when using a bounded queue channel that is currently full. Also, keep in mind that when sending to a DirectChannel, the invocation will occur in the sender's thread. Therefore, the failing of the send operation may be caused by other components further downstream. The "reply-timeout" attribute maps to the "sendTimeout" property of the underlying 'MessagingTemplate' instance (org.springframework.integration.core.MessagingTemplate). The attribute will default, if not specified, to '-1', meaning that by default, the Gateway will wait indefinitely. The value is specified in milliseconds.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: This attribute defaults to 'REPLACE' if not set explicitly. The following options are available: APPEND: If append is specified, the data will be appended to the existing file if such file exists, otherwise the new file will be created as usual but, once created, the subsequent data will be appended to it. This attribute is mutually exclusive with the use of a temporary file, since append is done to the actual file and not its temporary counterpart. The file is closed after each write. If set to APPEND, the component will also use instance of the LockRegistry to ensure that there are no collisions when multiple threads are writing to the same file. APPEND_NO_FLUSH: Same as 'APPEND' but the data is not flushed or the file closed. This can significantly improve performance at the risk of lost data in the event of a failure. Various strategies are available for flushing the data and closing the file. Refer to the reference documentation for more information. FAIL: If the target file exists, a MessageHandlingException is thrown. IGNORE: If the target file exists, the message payload is silently ignored. REPLACE: This is the default behavior when writing files. If the target file already exists, it will be overwritten. REPLACE_IF_MODIFIED: If the local file already exists, it will be overwritten only if the last modified timestamp does not match the source timestamp. Only applies to local files.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Allows you to specify a reference to [org.springframework.integration.file.filters.FileListFilter] bean. This filter acts against the remote server view when using the 'ls' or 'mget' commands. Only one of 'filter', 'filename-pattern', or 'filename-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: reply-channel
attributes.description: Identifies the reply channel attached to this gateway.

attributes.name: temporary-remote-directory-expression
attributes.description: Specify a SpEL expression which will be used to evaluate the temporary directory path to where files will be transferred before they are moved to the remote-directory (e.g., "headers.['remote_dir'] + '/temp/myTransfers'");

attributes.name: filename-regex
attributes.description: Allows you to provide Regular Expression to determine the file names retrieved by the 'ls' and 'mget' commands. (e.g., "f[o]+\.txt" etc.) Only one of 'filter', 'filename-pattern', or 'filename-regex' is allowed.

attributes.name: local-directory
attributes.description: Identifies directory path (e.g., "/local/mytransfers") where file will be transferred TO. This attribute is mutually exclusive with 'local-directory-expression'.

attributes.name: remote-filename-generator-expression
attributes.description: Allows you to provide SpEL expression which will compute file name of the remote file (e.g., assuming payload is java.io.File "payload.getName() + '.transferred'");

attributes.name: chmod
attributes.description: Change the mode of the file (or remote file) after writing. Integer value expressed in Octal, e.g. '644'.

attributes.name: rename-expression
attributes.description: SpEL expression representing the path for the new filename when using the 'mv' command. Defaults to "headers.['file_renameTo']".

attributes.name: filter-expression
attributes.description: The SpEL expression to evaluate against file to accept it for processing or not. Mutually exclusive with 'filter' attribute.

attributes.name: use-temporary-file-name
attributes.description: Allows you to suppress using a temporary file name while writing the file.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Assigns this endpoint to a role. Endpoints in a role can be started/stopped as a group. See 'SmartLifecycleRoleController'.

attributes.name: remote-directory
attributes.description: Identifies the remote directory path (e.g., "/remote/mytransfers") Mutually exclusive with 'remote-directory-expression'.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the order for invocation when this endpoint is connected as a subscriber to a channel. This is particularly relevant when that channel is using a "failover" dispatching strategy, or when a failure in the delivery to one subscriber should signal that the message should not be sent to subscribers with a higher 'order' attribute. It has no effect when this endpoint itself is a Polling Consumer for a channel with a queue.

attributes.name: session-factory
attributes.description: Reference to an [org.springframework.integration.file.remote.session.SessionFactory] bean with a [com.jcraft.jsch.ChannelSftp$LsEntry] generic type parameter.

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Allows you to specify Charset (e.g., US-ASCII, ISO-8859-1, UTF-8). [UTF-8] is default - used when converting String payloads to bytes.

children.name: poller
children.description: Defines a top-level poller - 'org.springframework.integration.scheduling.PollerMetadata'.

Basically this enum provides a convenience for SECONDS-based interval trigger values. For hourly, daily, and monthly settings, consider using a 'cron' trigger instead.

children.name: retry-advice
children.description: A convenient way of defining a MessageHandlerRetryAdvice. Uses a SimpleRetryPolicy and an optional Exponential or Fixed BackOffPolicy. Default is no back off.

attributes.description: A MessageChannel to receive the message after retries are exhausted. Default is to not recover and throw the exception.

attributes.description: The maximum number of attempts to invoke the handler. Default 3.

attributes.name: send-timeout
attributes.description: A timeout applied when sending to the 'recovery-channel'. Only applies if the recovery channel can block (such as a bounded QueueChannel that is full).
